scelerus: <entryFree id="n42912" type="main" key="sce^le^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wicked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. Serv <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 486</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sceleste: <entryFree id="n42913" type="main" key="sce^leste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlestē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. scelestus <sense id="n42913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scelestus: <entryFree id="n42914" type="main" key="sce^lestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scelus; like funestus, from funus</etym>, <sense id="n42914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wicked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">villanous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infamous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accursed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominable; knavish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roguish;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wicked person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a knave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rogue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoundrel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">miscreant</hi> (freq. ante-class. in Plaut. and Ter.; after the class. per. sceleratus is more freq.; by Cic. not used of persons). </sense><sense id="n42914.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sum malus, Ego sum sacer, scelestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eheu, scelestus galeam in navi perdidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjuravisti, sceleste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:120 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 120 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o scelestum atque audacem hominem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 103</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 26 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:52:15" default="NO" valid="yes">52, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16</bibl>, <cb n="SCEL" /> 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 7, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 22 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 2</bibl>.—As a term of reproach or abuse: sceleste, scelesta, etc., <hi rend="ital">you knave! you wretch!</hi> sceleste. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 120</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3</bibl>. 126; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 51</bibl>; id Eun. 4, 4, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelestissime, audes mihi praedicare id?</quote> <trans><tr>you arrant rogue!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">scelestum ac nefarium facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res scelesta, atrox, nefaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam quidquam facinus feci pejus neque scelestius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelesto facinori scelestiorem sermonem addidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelestae hae sunt aedes, impia est habitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelestior cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ser-vitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuam domum scelestis nuptiis fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 3:61:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. Fragm. 3, 61, 9</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">malitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42914.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in Plaut. for sceleratus (B. 2.), <hi rend="ital">baleful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calamitous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfortunate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelestiorem ego annum argento faenori Numquam ullum vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me (vidisti) adeo scelestum, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ego sum miser, Scelestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 17</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">scelesta, vae te!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 8, 15</bibl></cit> Ellis ad loc.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlestē</orth> (acc. to. I.), <hi rend="ital">wickedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viciously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detestably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleste atque impie facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parta bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insimulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:60:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 60, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interit pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 202" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 202</bibl></cit>.—Humorously: tu sceleste suspi-caris, ego <foreign lang="greek">a)felw=s</foreign> scripsi, <hi rend="ital">roguishly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sceletus: <entryFree id="n42915" type="greek" key="sce^le^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlĕtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skeleto/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a skeleton</hi>: eviscerata forma diri cadaveris, App. Mag. pp. 313, 35, and 315, 9 sq.</sense></entryFree>
scelio: <entryFree id="n42916" type="hapax" key="sce^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scelus</etym>, <sense id="n42916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wicked man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoundrel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus scelio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 50, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scelotyrbe: <entryFree id="n42917" type="main" key="sce^lo^tyrbe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlŏtyrbē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skelotu/rbh,</foreign> <sense id="n42917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lameness in the ankles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the knees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 3, 6, § 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scelus: <entryFree id="n42918" type="main" key="sce^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĕlus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root skhal, to fall, akin to khal-, to deceive; cf. Goth. skal, to owe</etym>, <sense id="n42918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an evil deed; a wicked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heinous</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">impious action; a crime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enormity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wickedness</hi> (the strongest general term for a morally bad act or quality; very freq. both in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; cf. nefas). </sense><sense id="n42918.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42918.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus est vincire civem Romanum, scelus verberare, prope parricidium necare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 170</bibl></cit>; cf. so (opp. to flagitia and delicta) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">majus in sese scelus concipere nefariis sceleribus coöpertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">detestabile scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus atque perfidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 109</bibl></cit>; so (with perfidia) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 107:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 107, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:39 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 39 al.</bibl>; cf. (with audacia) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:66:section=170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 66, § 170</bibl>; (with furor) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 62</bibl>, § 161; (with avaritia) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 9</bibl>, § 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">documentum Persarum sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac parte pudor pugnat, illinc petulantia ... hinc pietas, illinc scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus est igitur, nocere bestiae, quod scelus qui velit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:11:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mali aut sceleris fingi aut excogitari potest, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefario scelere concepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:32:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 32, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concipere in se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">9 (v. supra): tantum sceleris admittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus nefarium facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 221</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 68, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus an-helare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moliri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">edere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelere se alligare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelere astringi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 50, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelere obstringi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:32:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 32, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obrui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n42918.3" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus legatorum contra jus gentium interfectorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the crime of murdering their deputies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgo dicitur: Scelera non habere consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42918.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42918.5" n="A" level="2"> Of animals or inanimate things (post-Aug.; perh. only in Plin.), <hi rend="ital">a bad quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vicious nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a vice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fault</hi>: nec bestiarum solum ad nocendum scelera <pb n="1641" /> <cb n="SCEP" /> sunt, sed interim aquarum quoque et locorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 3, 6, § 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximum salamandrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 23, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythae sagittas tingunt viperină sanie ... inremediabile id scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 53, 115, § 279</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42918.6" n="B" level="2"> Concr., in vulgar lang. as a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">rascal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoundrel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">villain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rogue;</hi> and of women, <hi rend="ital">drab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baggage</hi>, etc.: minime miror, navis si fracta tibi, Scelus te et sceleste parta quae vexit bona, Plant. Rud. 2, 6, 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Am. 2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Bacch. 5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Mil. 3:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Pers. 4:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 12 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus viri,</quote> <trans><tr>you scoundrel of a man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 60</bibl></cit>.— With a <hi rend="ital">masc. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is me scelus attondit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi illic est scelus, quid me perdidit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus, quemnam hic laudat?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42918.7" n="C" level="2"> In Plaut., Ter., and Mart., <hi rend="ital">a mishap</hi> (qs. arising from wickedness), <hi rend="ital">a misfortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calamity</hi> (cf. sceleratus, B. 2., and scelestus, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">perdidi unum filium puerum quadrimum ... Major potitus hostium est: quod hoc est scelus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 104</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Quid hoc est sceleris? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Perii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 34</bibl> Ruhnk.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:14:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 14, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42918.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A natural catastrophe</hi>: scelera naturae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">earthquakes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inundations</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 206</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scena:
<entryFree id="n42919" type="main" key="sce_na" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scēna</orth>, v. scaena.
†† <sense id="n42919.0" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">scēna</orth> <itype>ab aliis, a quibusdam sacena appellatur, dolabra pontificalis</itype>, Fest. pp. 330 and 319 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
scenarius: <entryFree id="n42920" type="main" key="sce_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scēnārĭus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scēnĭcus</orth>, etc., v. scaenarius, scaenicus, etc.</entryFree>
scenites: <entryFree id="n42921" type="greek" key="sce_ni_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scēnītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skhni/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n42921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who dwells in a tent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of a nomadic race</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nomades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scenofactorius: <entryFree id="n42922" type="main" key="sce_no^facto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scēnŏfactōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">skh=nos</foreign> -facio</etym>, <sense id="n42922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the making of tents</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <trans><tr>the business of tent-making</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 18, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scenopegia: <entryFree id="n42923" type="main" key="sce_no^pe_gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scēnŏpēgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skhnophgi/a,</foreign> <sense id="n42923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Jewish Feast of Tabernacles</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Macc. 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Johan. 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scepsis: <entryFree id="n42924" type="main" key="Sce_psis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scēpsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*skh=yis,</foreign> <sense id="n42924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Mysia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 122</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scēp-sĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Scepsis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metrodorus,</quote> <trans><tr>of Scepsis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 16, § 34</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called simply Scepsius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:14:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 14, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sceptici: <entryFree id="n42925" type="main" key="Scepti^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sceptĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*skeptikoi/,</foreign> <sense id="n42925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Sceptics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the disciples of Pyrrho</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sceptos: <entryFree id="n42926" type="greek" key="sce_ptos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scēptos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skhpto/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">storm</hi>, that rushes from above, App. de Mundo, p. 64, 5.</sense></entryFree>
sceptrifer: <entryFree id="n42927" type="main" key="sce_ptri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scēptrĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sceptrum-fero</etym>, <sense id="n42927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sceptre-bearing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">manus Servi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:480" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tonantes,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Jupiter and Juno</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 59" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sceptriger: <entryFree id="n42928" type="main" key="sce_ptri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scēptrĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sceptrumgero</etym>, <sense id="n42928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sceptre-bearing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Laii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:636" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:245" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 245</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sceptrum: <entryFree id="n42929" type="greek" key="sce_ptrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scēptrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">scaep-trum</orth>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skh=ptron,</foreign> <sense id="n42929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a royal staff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sceptre.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42929.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rex Ptolemaeus) sedens cum purpurā et sceptro et illis insignibus regiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:26:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 26, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:158" default="NO">11, 3, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 247</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrā sceptrum gerebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 206</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 178</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 847</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 422. Also borne by a king's daughter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 653</bibl></cit> Heyne: <cit><quote lang="la">exitiale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:34" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a triumphant general,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 43</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in the <number>plur.</number>, by way of amplification, of a single sceptre, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 12, 21; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">celsā sedet Aeolus arce Sceptra tenens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 57</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of Juno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 265</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 596</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 560</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 173</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 252 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42929.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n42929.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A teacher</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s rod</hi> (humorously): <cit><quote lang="la">ferulae tristes, sceptra paedagogorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:62:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 62, 10</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n42929.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A name of the plant</hi> aspalathus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 24, 52, § 110</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42929.5" n="3" level="3"> = membrum virile, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42929.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, as a symbol of authority, also used by the poets, in the <number>plur.</number>, for <hi rend="ital">kingdom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dominion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">authority</hi>: en impero Argis, sceptra mihi liquit Pelops, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:140" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu mihi quodcumque hoc regni, tu sceptra Jovemque Concilias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic nos in sceptra reponis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 253</bibl></cit>; 7, 422; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 9: pulsus solio sceptrisque paternis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SCHO" /> 852: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptra Asiae tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potiri perenni sceptro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 585</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:198" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 677</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Heliconiadum comites, quorum unus Homerus Sceptra potitus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1038" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1038</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sceptuchus: <entryFree id="n42930" type="greek" key="sce_ptu_chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scēptūchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skhptou=xos,</foreign> <sense id="n42930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sceptre-bearer</hi>, a high officer of state in the East, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scheda: <entryFree id="n42931" type="main" key="sche^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schĕda</orth>, v. scida.</entryFree>
schedius: <entryFree id="n42932" type="greek" key="sche^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schĕdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sxe/dios,</foreign> <sense id="n42932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made suddenly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off-hand; hastily put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thrown together;</hi> hence, as in the Greek <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n42932.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">schĕdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sxedi/a</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">nau=s</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a raft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">float</hi>, constructed in haste, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:1:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 1, 1, § 6</bibl>; cf. Fest. pp. 334 and 335 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n42932.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">schĕdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. carmen), <hi rend="ital">an extemporaneous poem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucilianae humilitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 364, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 7 praef.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 3</bibl>; cf. Fest. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
schedula: <entryFree id="n42933" type="main" key="sche^du^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schĕdŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scĭdŭla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scheda or scida</etym>, <sense id="n42933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small leaf of paper</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ruf. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
schema: <entryFree id="n42934" type="greek" key="sche_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schēma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (cf.: <sense id="n42934.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">diadema, dogma, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679</bibl></cit> P.), and (mostly post-Aug.) <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> schemasin, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 38</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but schematibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 19</bibl></cit>), = <foreign lang="greek">sxh=ma.</foreign> </sense><sense id="n42934.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">posture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attitude</hi>, etc. (so mostly ante-class.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n42934.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod processi huc cum servili schemā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 117</bibl></cit>; cf. Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiara ut lepidam lepide condecorat schemam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit> Ritschl; cf. Prisc. l. l.; also Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 225, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplar imperatae schemae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42934.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: pergite thyrsigerae Bacchae modo Bacchico cum schemate, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 225, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">schema antiquom retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 225:3" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 225, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristippus naufragio cum ejectus ad Rhodiensium litus animadvertisset geometrica schemata descripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa schematibus libidinosissimis inquinata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42934.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., as in rhet., <hi rend="ital">a figure of speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rhetorical figure</hi> (pure Lat. figura; freq. in Quint.; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. written as Greek),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § 23 sq.; 1, 1, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 1 sq.</bibl>; and repeatedly in the first three chapters of the ninth book; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:52 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 52 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:49" default="NO">4, 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:4" default="NO">4, 5, 4</bibl>; 5, 10, 70.—</sense><sense id="n42934.5" n="b" level="4"> In geometry, <hi rend="ital">a figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">geometrica schemata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, praef. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaeroides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
schematismos: <entryFree id="n42935" type="greek" key="sche_ma^tismos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schēmătismos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sxhmatismo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figurative</hi> or <hi rend="ital">florid manner of speaking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
schidia: <entryFree id="n42936" type="greek" key="schi^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schĭdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sxi/dai</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">sxi/dia,</foreign> <sense id="n42936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splinter</hi> of wood, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
schinus: <entryFree id="n42937" type="main" key="schi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sxi=nos,</foreign> <sense id="n42937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mastic-tree</hi> (pure Lat. lentiscus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 13, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
schisma: <entryFree id="n42938" type="greek" key="schisma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sxi/sma,</foreign> <sense id="n42938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a split</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disunion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">schism</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 5</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 11, 19; 11, 30; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 9, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
schismaticus: <entryFree id="n42939" type="greek" key="schisma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schismătĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sxismatiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separatist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seceder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">schismatic</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">schismaticos non fides diversa facit, sed communionis disrupta societas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quaest. in Matt. 11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quaest. in Matt. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
schistos: <entryFree id="n42940" type="main" key="schistos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schistos</orth>, <itype>a, on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sxisto/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">split</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divided;</hi> a t. t. in Pliny the Elder: lapis, <hi rend="ital">that easily cleaves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cracks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fissile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">schistose</hi>, a name given to a kind of <hi rend="ital">red oxide of iron</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:84" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 4, 25, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:144" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 20, 37, § 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>curdled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 33, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caepa, a peculiar kind,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
schoeneus: <entryFree id="n42941" type="main" key="Schoeneus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Schoeneus</orth>, <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sxoineu/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Bœotia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Atalanta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 244" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:246" default="NO">246</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42941.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Schoenēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Schœneus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Atalanta</hi>, Ov. H. (15) 16, 263; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Am. 1:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 7, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42941.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Schoe-nēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Schœneus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Atalanta</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 660</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:399" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 399</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Schoe-nēïa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Atalanta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 609</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42941.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Schoenis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Atalanta</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 14, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
schoeniculae: <entryFree id="n42942" type="main" key="schoeni^cu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schoenĭcŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>schoenum</etym>, <sense id="n42942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prostitutes anointed with</hi> schoenum, Plaut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 64</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. Fest. pp. 328 and 329 ib.</sense></entryFree>
schoenis: <entryFree id="n42943" type="main" key="Schoenis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Schoenis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Schoeneus, C.</entryFree>
schoenobates: <entryFree id="n42944" type="greek" key="schoeno^ba^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schoenŏbătes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sxoinoba/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n42944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rope-dancer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:77" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 77</bibl>. <cb n="SCHO" /></sense></entryFree>
schoenus: <entryFree id="n42945" type="greek" key="schoenus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schoenus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n42945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">schoenum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 2</bibl> and 5, somewhat dub.), = <foreign lang="greek">sxoi=nos, o(.</foreign> </sense><sense id="n42945.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rush</hi>, of an aromatic kind (pure Lat. juncus), used by the Romans to season wine, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 105, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">113, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:5" default="NO">12, 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:53:2" default="NO">12, 53, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">low women anointed themselves with a perfume made from it: schoeno delibutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 55</bibl></cit> (where others read caeno delibutae); cf. also schoeniculae.—</sense><sense id="n42945.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A measure of distance</hi> among the Persians (= 40 stadia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 14, 30, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
schola: <entryFree id="n42946" type="greek" key="scho^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schŏla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scŏla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sxolh/</foreign> (spare time, leisure; hence, in partic.), <sense id="n42946.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Leisure given to learning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a learned conversation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">debate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disputation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lecture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissertation</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in quam exercitationem (disputandi) ita nos studiose operam dedimus, ut jam etiam scholas Graecorum more habere auderemus ... Itaque dierum quinque scholas, ut Graeci appellant, in totidem libros contuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">separatim certae scholae sunt de exsilio, de interitu patriae, etc. ... Haec Graeci in singulas scholas et in singulos libros dispertiunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 34, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scholam aliquam explicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habes scholam Stoicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertes te ad alteram scholam: disseres de triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sunt vestrae scholae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 59</bibl> Spald.—</sense><sense id="n42946.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42946.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A place for learned conversation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">instruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a place of learning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a school</hi> (cf. ludus): <cit><quote lang="la">toto hoc de genere, de quaerendā, de collocandā pecuniā, commodius a quibusdam optimis viris ad Janum medium sedentibus quam ab ullis philosophis ullā in scholā disputatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:25:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 25, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum in scholā assedissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11</bibl>. 26: <cit><quote lang="la">politus e scholā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e philosophorum scholis tales fere evadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl>, prooem. § 17; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 3, 12: rhetorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potiorem in scholis eruditionem esse quam domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:45" default="NO">5, 13, 45</bibl>; so (opp. forum) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ab Homero in scholis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42946.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A gallery</hi> where works of art were exhibited: <cit><quote lang="la">Octaviae scholae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 10, 3, § 114</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42946.4" n="c" level="4"> Scholae bestiarum, <hi rend="ital">a place where animals fight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an amphitheatre</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42946.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The disciples</hi> or <hi rend="ital">followers of a teacher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a school</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamabunt omnia gymnasia atque omnes philosophorum scholae, sua haec esse omnia propria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:13:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 13, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (Isocratis) schola principes oratorum dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Theodori schola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scholae Asclepiadis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissederunt hae diu scholae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassianae scholae princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42946.6" n="b" level="4"> In the time of the later emperors, <hi rend="ital">a college</hi> or <hi rend="ital">corporation</hi> of the army or of persons of the same profession: Schola Exceptorum, Chartulariorum, Singulariorum, etc., Cod. Th. 12, 20, 20; 12, 17, 2 et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 65, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42946.7" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The building of that corporation</hi>, Inscr. in Jahn's Neue Jahrb. vol. 66, p. 338.—* </sense><sense id="n42946.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place in a bathing-room where one waited before entering the bath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a waiting-place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
scholaris: <entryFree id="n42947" type="main" key="scho^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schŏlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>schola</etym>. <sense id="n42947.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a school</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">incohamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 326</bibl></cit>: murmur, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 9, 16: <cit><quote lang="la">declamatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 36, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42947.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to schola, I. B. 2. b.) <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">schŏlāres</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the imperial guard</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 18, 1; 7, 4, 34; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 38, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scholasticus: <entryFree id="n42948" type="greek" key="scho^lasti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schŏlastĭcus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n42948.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> = <foreign lang="greek">sxolastiko/s,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a school</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scholastic</hi> (post-Aug., and in gen. referring to the schools of rhetoric): <cit><quote lang="la">controversiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:97" default="NO">4, 2, 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declamationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scholasticae atque umbraticae litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 9</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">schŏlastĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">school-exercises</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scholasticis nonnumquam evenit, ut pro narratione sit propositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:14" default="NO">7, 1, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42948.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">schŏlastĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who teaches</hi> or <hi rend="ital">studies rhetoric</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lecturer in the schools</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rhetorician</hi> (opp. to a public orator): <cit><quote lang="la">(Isaeus rhetor) annum sexagesimum excessit et adhuc scholasticus tantum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: nunc adulescentuli nostri deducuntur in scenas scholasticorum qui <pb n="1642" /> <cb n="SCIE" /> rhetores vocantur, quos, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentis scholasticorum clamoribus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with the applause of the scholars</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 15</bibl></cit>.—Of rhetoricians, who, on account of their knowledge of law, acted as <hi rend="ital">pleaders</hi> or <hi rend="ital">advocates</hi> in lawsuits, Cod. Th. 8, 10, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tract. in Joann. 7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Tract. in Joann. 7</bibl>.—As a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">a pedant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heus tu scholastice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 119, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 61, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42948.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a man of learning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scholar</hi>, Alex. Aur. ap. Capit. Maxim. jun. 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4</bibl>, prooem. § 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Vir. Ill. 99 al.</bibl>—Of a <hi rend="ital">grammarian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 7, 4</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">schŏlastĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rhetorically</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scholicus: <entryFree id="n42949" type="greek" key="scho^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">schŏlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">sxoliko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n42949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a school</hi>, <hi rend="ital">school</hi>- (anteand post-class.): dape, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 452, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam nugalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axioma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 327</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sciadeus: <entryFree id="n42950" type="greek" key="sci^a^deus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭădeus</orth>, <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skiadeu/s</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">ski/aina,</foreign> the male and female of <sense id="n42950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-fish;</hi> perh. <hi rend="ital">a kind of grayling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ombre</hi>: Salmo thymallus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sciaena: <entryFree id="n42951" type="main" key="sci^aena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. sciadeus.</entryFree>
sciagraphia: <entryFree id="n42952" type="main" key="sci^a_gra^phi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭāgrăphĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. scenographia <sense id="n42952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sciapodes: <entryFree id="n42953" type="main" key="Scia_po^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sciāpŏdes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Scĭŏpŏdes</orth>), <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*skia/poses,</foreign> <sense id="n42953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous people in Libya</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with monstrously large soles to their feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which they were said to turn up and use as umbrellas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 8</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 16, 8.</sense></entryFree>
sciathos: <entryFree id="n42954" type="main" key="Sci^a^thos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scĭăthos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ski/aqos,</foreign> <sense id="n42954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the Sinus Thermaicus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a town of the same name</hi>, now still <hi rend="ital">Skiatho</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:13" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scibilis: <entryFree id="n42955" type="main" key="sci_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scībĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scio</etym>, <sense id="n42955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">knowable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discernible</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Deus non omnibus scibilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia rei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 375</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scida: <entryFree id="n42956" type="main" key="sci^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭda</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">schĕda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sxi/dn, sxe/dh,</foreign> <sense id="n42956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strip of papyrus bark</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 77</bibl>.—Form scheda, <hi rend="ital">a leaf</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sheet of paper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:89:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 89, 4</bibl> (form scheda; al. scida).</sense></entryFree>
sciens: <entryFree id="n42957" type="main" key="sci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from scio.</entryFree>
scienter: <entryFree id="n42958" type="main" key="sci^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. scio, <sense id="n42958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scientia: <entryFree id="n42959" type="main" key="sci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<number>plur.</number> only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3</bibl>, praef. 1) [sciens], <sense id="n42959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a knowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">being skilled in</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">knowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">science</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skill,</hi> <hi rend="ital">expertness</hi>, = cognitio, eruditio (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n42959.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut scire istarum rerum nihil, aut, etiamsi maxime sciemus, nec meliores ob eam scientiam nec beatiores esse possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a scientiae delectatione ad efficiendi utilitatem referre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiochus ingenio scientiāque putatur excellere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes trahimur ad cognitionis et scientiae cupiditatem ... omnis autem cogitatio aut in consiliis capiendis aut in studiis scientiae cognitionisque versabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:18 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 18 sq.</bibl></cit>; so (with cognitio) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 158</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 18, 48 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere altissimam eruditionem ac scientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his difficultatibus duae res erant subsidio, scientia atque usus militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. so (with usus) infra, <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam rem esse declarant in usu positam militari, quae hujus viri scientiam fugere possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notabo singulas res: etsi nullo modo poterit oratio mea satisfacere vestrae scientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 23, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 92</bibl>: tuae scientiae excellenti ac singulari non multo plus quam nostri relictum est loci, i. e. <hi rend="ital">for jurisprudence</hi> than for <hi rend="ital">oratory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars earum rerum est, quae sciuntur: oratoris autem omnis actio opinionibus, non scientiā continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi ars, cum eā non utare, scientiā tamen ipsā teneri potest,</quote> <trans><tr>in theory</tr>, <tr>theoretically</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; so (opp. ars) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter (Cratippus) te scientiā augere potest, altera (urbs Athenarum) exemplis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 14, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam efficaci do manus scientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trivialis scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: cum tanta sit celeritas animorum ... tot artes tantae scientiae, tot inventa, <hi rend="ital">requiring so great knowledge</hi> (scientiae is <hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 21, 78</bibl> (dub.; B. and K. bracket the words tantae scientiae); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">physica ipsa et mathematica scientiae sunt eorum, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 14, 61</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cb n="SCIL" /> disciplinarum scientiae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3</bibl>, praef. § 1. —</sense><sense id="n42959.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum magnarum atque artium scientiam consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>; (with cognitio rei) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29, 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneti scientiā atque usu nauticarum rerum reliquos antecedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine regionum terrestrium aut maritimarum scientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 14, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoratio futurorum malorum utilior est quam scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:9:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; so (opp. ignoratio) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 13, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrologiae scientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dialecticorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnationis (with artificium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae Gallicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colendorum deorum (sanctitas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 41, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum aut faciendorum aut deligendorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: qui in alienis morbis profitentur tenere se medicinae scientiam, Serv. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundendi aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:153" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 12, 44, § 153</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n42959.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">scientia in legibus interpretandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in affectibus omnis generis movendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus scientiam de omnibus constat fuisse, ejus ignoratio de aliquo purgatio debet videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 13, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scientiola: <entryFree id="n42960" type="main" key="sci^enti^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭentĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scientia</etym>, <sense id="n42960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little knowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a smattering</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 11, 31: <cit><quote lang="la">parvas concinnavit scientiolas artium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scilicet: <entryFree id="n42961" type="main" key="sci_li^cet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scīlĭcet</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from sci- (root of scire) licet; cf. vide-licet, i-licet</etym>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">scīre lĭcet</orth>, as it is freq. written in Lucr. and in archaic lang. in Liv., and sometimes in Cels.; prop., you may understand or know, = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dhlono/ti,</foreign> and serving to imply that a statement is in itself obviously true, and is not overlooked by the speaker (cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 3</bibl>). <sense id="n42961.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">it is evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">manifest; of course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">naturally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evidently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undoubtedly</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; cf.: nimirum, nempe). </sense><sense id="n42961.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi> on account of scire (ante-class., and several times in Sall.; cf. videlicet): <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Neque illa ulli homini nutet, nictet, annuat, etc. <hi rend="ital">Di.</hi> Optumumst: <cit><quote lang="la">Ita scilicet facturam,</quote> <trans><tr>very good; of course she will do so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 117</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 469</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:102:9" default="NO" valid="yes">102, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:113:3" default="NO" valid="yes">113, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Fragm. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fragm. 1</bibl>, Orat. Phil. § 5.—</sense><sense id="n42961.2" n="(b)" level="5"> As a simple particle: <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Tam ego homo sum quam tu. <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Scilicet ita res est, <hi rend="ital">that is clear enough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">no one disputes that</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 83</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Co.</hi> Utrum amicis hodie an inimicis tuis Daturu's cenam? <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Pol ego amicis scilicet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc vivat necne, id Orcum scire oportet scilicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pol me haud paenitet Scilicet boni dimidium mihi dividere cum Jove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video jam illum virum cui praeficias officio et muneri. Huic scilicet, Africanus (inquit), uni paene: nam in hoc fere uno sunt cetera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:42:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 42, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38, 60</bibl>: quā mente esset Antonius, demonstravit: pessima scilicet et infidelissima, Nam, etc., Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 1, 1</bibl>: a te litteras exspectabam: nondum scilicet; <cit><quote lang="la">nam has mane rescribebam,</quote> <trans><tr>not yet to be sure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me in dolore ... maxime scilicet consolatur spes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q.
