Fr. 2, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ad haec Naevius? ridet scilicet nostram amentiam, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego valde suspenso animo exspecto, primum te scilicet, deinde Marionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videtis ut senectus sit operosa et semper agens aliquid et moliens: tale scilicet, quale cujusque studium in superiore vita fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>such</tr>, <tr>naturally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brutus terram osculo contigit: scilicet, quod ea communis mater omnium mortalium esset,</quote> <trans><tr>evidently because</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —Often followed by <hi rend="ital">sed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tamen</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoscat (orator) rerum gestarum et memoriae veteris ordinem, maxime scilicet nostrae civitatis, sed etiam imperiosorum populorum et regum illustrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet nimis hic quidem est progressus, sed ex eo ipso est conjectura facilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:23:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 23, 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime scilicet in homine, sed in omni animali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me species quaedam commovit, inanis scilicet, sed commovit tamen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: nihil scilicet novi, ea tamen quae te ipsum probaturum esse confidam,<cb n="SCIN" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuli scilicet moleste, ut debui, sed tamen constitui ad te venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: tu interea Romae scilicet amicis praesto fuisti; <cit><quote lang="la">sed tamen illud cogita, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 20, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Meneclides quidam, satis exercitatus in dicendo, ut Thebanus scilicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: nota scilicet illa res, cum Decimus quidam Verginius, etc., <hi rend="ital">that event is surely well known</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Rep. 2:37:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl>.—In an assertion put in the form of a question: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Huc cum advenio, nulla erat. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Comites secuti scilicet sunt virginem? <hi rend="ital">followed her of course</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42961.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Elliptically (only ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">manifesta palam res indicat, inquis, in auras Aëris e terrā res omnes crescere alique, etc. ... Scilicet: et nisi nos, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to be sure</tr>, <tr>by all means</tr>, <tr>quite right</tr>, <tr>certainly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:809" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 809</bibl></cit>. —Esp. as an answer: <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Abi ad meam sororem. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Ibitur. <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Et gratulator meae sorori. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Scilicet, <hi rend="ital">of course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 9</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n42961.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">of course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubtless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forsooth</hi>, when an assertion that is obviously false is ironically made or accepted (class.): <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Meum gnatum rumor est amare. <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Id populus curat scilicet! <hi rend="ital">of course people trouble themselves a great deal about that!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 14</bibl> (also cited <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 34</bibl>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet is superis labor est, ea cura quietos Sollicitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 379</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ego id scilicet nesciebam!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tu scilicet mavis numine deorum id factum quam casu arbitrari?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:21:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 21, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 54, § 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet tibi graviorem dolorem patrui tui mors attulit quam C. Graccho fratris, et tibi acerbior ejus patrui mors est, quem numquam vidisti quam illi ejus fratris, quicum concordissime vixerat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet is sum, qui existimem, Cn. Pisonem et Catilinam nihil scelerate ipsos per sese sine P. Sullā facere potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 24, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl>, prooem. § 25; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unde illa scilicet egregia laudatio: Tanto melior, ne ego quidem intellexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet medio triennio defuerat tempus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 3, 59; 11, 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42961.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in the postAug. per. sometimes, like <foreign lang="greek">dhlono/ti</foreign> in later Greek, merely as an expletory or explanatory particle, <hi rend="ital">namely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is to say</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam etiam opera sub nomine alieno, nepotum scilicet et uxoris sororisque, fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manente villā, qualis fuerit olim, ne quid scilicet oculorum consuetudini deperiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ne scilicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 25</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
scilla: <entryFree id="n42962" type="greek" key="sci^lla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭlla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">squilla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ski/lla.</foreign> <sense id="n42962.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sea-onion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-leek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squill</hi>: Scilla maritima, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 30, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:97" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 9, 39, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:106" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 17, 66, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:33" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:34" default="NO">12, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mart. 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jul. 8, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42962.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small fish of the lobster kind</hi>, which defends the pinna, <hi rend="ital">a prawn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrimp</hi>: Cancer squilla, Linn.; <cit><quote lang="la">in this sense more usually written squilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 42, 66, § 142</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:83" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scillinus: <entryFree id="n42963" type="greek" key="scilli^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scillĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ski/llinos,</foreign> <sense id="n42963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of sea-onions</hi> or <hi rend="ital">squills</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <trans><tr>vinegar flavored with squills</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 28, § 59</bibl></cit>; also called acetum scilliticum (<foreign lang="greek">skillitiko/n</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 19, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:34" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 47, § 135</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 510</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scillites: <entryFree id="n42964" type="greek" key="scilli_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scillītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skilli/ths</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">oi=)nos</foreign>), <sense id="n42964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine seasoned with squills</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:33" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jul. 6</bibl>.—Hence, also, acetum scillites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 48, § 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scilliticus: <entryFree id="n42965" type="main" key="scilli_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scillītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. scillinus.</entryFree>
scimpodion: <entryFree id="n42966" type="greek" key="scimpo^di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scimpŏdĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skimpo/dion,</foreign> <sense id="n42966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">couch</hi> (syn. grabatus): <cit><quote lang="la">Graeciense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scin: <entryFree id="n42967" type="main" key="sci_n'"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scīn'</orth> for <orth extent="full" lang="la">scisne</orth>, v. scio <sense id="n42967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scincos: <entryFree id="n42968" type="greek" key="scincos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scincos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ski/gkos,</foreign> <sense id="n42968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of lizard</hi> common in Asia and Africa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 38, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:119" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 8, 30, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:43" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 5, 16, § 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scindo: <entryFree id="n42969" type="main" key="scindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scindo</orth>, <itype>scĭdi, scissum, 3</itype> (old <sense id="n42969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. redupl.</hi> scicidi, Enn., Naev., Att, and Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 890</bibl> P.; or <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 133</bibl> Vanl.; Com. Rel. pp. 19 and 164 Rib.; cf. also, sciciderat. <pb n="1643" /> <cb n="SCIN" /> Gell 6, 9, 16), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>akin to Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sxi/zw,</foreign> to split; cf. Germ. scheiden, and Lat. scio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rend</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">break asunder; to split</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">separate</hi> by force, etc. (freq. and class.; but in <hi rend="ital">tempp.perf.</hi>ante-class.and postAug.; syn.: findo, rumpo). </sense><sense id="n42969.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: quom saxum scisciderit, Enn. ap. Prisc. l. l.: non ergo aquila scisciderat pectus, Att. ib. and ap. Gell. l. l.: satis fortiter vestras sciscidistis colus, Afran. ap. Prisc. l. l.: scindens dolore identidem intonsam comam, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:870" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 870</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 683</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 55</bibl>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, in a Greek construction: scissaeque capillos matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <trans><tr>to tear open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15</bibl> (3, 7), 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 27</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem tibi de corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:5:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecora scindunt herbarum radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asini me mordicibus scindant,</quote> <trans><tr>tear</tr>, <tr>lacerate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus flagello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:185" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerum corpus ictibus innumeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:172" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiato fistula plumbo Scinditur,</quote> <trans><tr>bursts open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 123</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et faceret scissas languida ruga genas,</quote> <trans><tr>wrinkled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:10:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum,</quote> <trans><tr>to break through</tr>, <tr>tear up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen portae,</quote> <trans><tr>to break in pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <trans><tr>to break down</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuneis lignum,</quote> <trans><tr>to split</tr>, <tr>cleave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercum cuneis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuneis fissile robur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 182</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro aequor (i. e. humum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomere terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 671</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta ictu (remorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvios natatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 4, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellurem mare scindit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">labra,</quote> <trans><tr>to open wide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsonium,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut up</tr>, <tr>carve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nihil (edulium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:12:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves in frusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42969.2" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: penulam alicui, <hi rend="ital">to tear off one's travelling cloak</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to urge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicit one to stay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 33, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42969.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide;</hi> of places: <cit><quote lang="la">dirimit scinditque Sueviam continuum montium jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons Italia in duo se cornua scindit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: omnis Italia scinditur in duo promuntoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 18</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">se (lutamenta),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (nubes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 587</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis fumus, vapor, etc. ... scinduntur per iter flexum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scinditur in geminas partes circumfluus amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 739</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 551</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentes quod tetigere, ilico rapiunt: si eas ereptum, ilico scindunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42969.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scindunt proceres Pergamum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 130</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42969.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to tear in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to distract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem quāvis scindunt cuppedine curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:994" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 994</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantae tum scindunt hominem cuppedinis acres Sollicitum curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 46</bibl></cit>: nolo commemorare, quibus rebus sim spoliatus, ne scindam ipse dolorem meum, <hi rend="ital">tear open</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">renew my grief</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sine piaculo sanctissimas necessitudines scindi,</quote> <trans><tr>to be sundered</tr>, <tr>separated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:37" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (actio) noctis interventu scinderetur,</quote> <trans><tr>was interrupted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba fletu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:157" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox scinditur,</quote> <trans><tr>is broken</tr>, <tr>cracked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic genus amborum scindit se sanguine ab uno,</quote> <trans><tr>divides</tr>, <tr>branches off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 142</bibl></cit>; cf.: scidit deinde se studium atque inertiā factum est, ut artes esse plures viderentur, <hi rend="ital">was separated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divided</hi>, Quint. prooem. § 13; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">naturalis pars philosophiae in duo scinditur corporalia et incorporalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scinditur incertum studia in contraria vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scindebatur in multiplices curas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">scissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">split</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divided.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42969.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia pluribus divisuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis folio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scissae (aures) cervis ac velut divisae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 50, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:13:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 13, 1</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">scissile alumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 11</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">vestibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42969.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus vocum,</quote> <trans><tr>harsh</tr>, <tr>grating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 216</bibl></cit>.—No <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, or <pos>adv.</pos></sense></entryFree>
scindula: <entryFree id="n42970" type="main" key="scindu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scindŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scindo</etym>, <sense id="n42970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a split piece of wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shingle;</hi> later form of scandula, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
scinifes: <entryFree id="n42971" type="main" key="sci^ni^fes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭnĭfes</orth>, v. cinifes. <cb n="SCIO" /></entryFree>
scintilla: <entryFree id="n42972" type="main" key="scintilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scintilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">spinqh/r</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n42972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spark</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n42972.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>; <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">videmus Accedere ex unā scintillā incendia passim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 609</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:606" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 606</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva saepe scintilla contempta excitavit incendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 675</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:163" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:29 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 29 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n42972.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparkling point</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis ut in auro lucentibus scintillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 31, § 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42972.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a spark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glimmer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faint trace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scintilla ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 21, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti tantis offusis tenebris ne scintillam quidem ullam nobis ad dispiciendum reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne scintillam quidem relinques, genus qui congliscat tuom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scintillatio: <entryFree id="n42973" type="hapax" key="scintilla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scintillātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scintillo</etym>, <sense id="n42973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sparkling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum, as a disease,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scintillo: <entryFree id="n42974" type="main" key="scintillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scintillo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>scintilla</etym>, <sense id="n42974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sparkle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glitter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gleam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flash</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. fulguro). </sense><sense id="n42974.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgetra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 43, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeus ardens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 34, 34, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testā ardente oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbunculi contra radios solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cristae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:593" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 593</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42974.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">scintillavit cruentis Ira genis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:562" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc Venus et calidi scintillat fervor amoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatis ardor, qui scintillet in animis audientium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 18, 22.</sense></entryFree>
scintillula: <entryFree id="n42975" type="main" key="scintillu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scintillŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little spark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sparklet</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">eas in pueris virtutum quasi scintillulas videmus, e quibus accendi philosophi ratio debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 91</bibl></cit> Fleck.</sense></entryFree>

<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scibis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scibit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scibimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scibunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Perf.</hi> sciit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1, 17</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> scibitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scin' for scisne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 200</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 8</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 6</bibl>; 4, 7, 30 et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Perf.</hi> sync. scisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:527" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 527</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scirint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 33</bibl></cit>; so, regularly, <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> scisse, e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:13:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 13, 58</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 17</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root sci-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kei/w</foreign> (for <foreign lang="greek">skei/w</foreign>), <foreign lang="greek">kea/zw,</foreign> to split, divide; cf.: scisco, plebiscitum, etc., prop. to distinguish, discern</etym>. </sense><sense id="n42976.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42976.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to know</hi>, in the widest signif. of the word; <hi rend="ital">to understand; perceive; to have knowledge of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">skill in</hi> any thing, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimā mutatione figuramus, Scio, Non ignoro, et Non me fugit, et Non me praeterit, et Quis nescit? et Nemini dubium est. Sed etiam ex proximo mutuari licet. Nam et intellego et sentio et video saepe idem valent quod scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 13</bibl></cit> (freq. in all styles and periods; cf. nosco). </sense><sense id="n42976.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut scire istarum rerum nihil, aut, etiam si maxime sciemus, nec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vilicus naturam agri novit, dispensator litteras scit, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nec didicerint nec umquam scire curaverint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego omnem rem scio Quemadmodum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id equidem ego certo scio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod pro certo sciam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Ubi ipse est? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Nescio. Nihil jam me oportet scire ... nescio etiam id quod scio, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec scivisti et me celavisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is omnes linguas scit: sed dissimulat sciens, Se scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 112</bibl></cit> (cf. supra, litteras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 3, 5</bibl>): comoediam, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 277, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene id opus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventutis mores qui sciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: remuneremini<cb n="SCIO" />  nos, ac quae scitis, proferatis in me dium: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo enim omnia potest scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec scire fas est omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SENATVOSQVE SENTENTIAM VTEI SCIENTES ESETIS, S. C. de Bacch. 23, ap. Wordsw. Fragm. and Spec. p. 173: quod scio, omne ex hoc scio,</quote> <trans><tr>I know all from him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:2:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 2, 3 al.</bibl> (v. infra, <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign>; and cf. in the foll., with <hi rend="ital">de</hi> instead of <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod sciam,</quote> <trans><tr>for aught I know</tr>, <tr>as far as I know</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 35 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:63 al" default="NO">9, 4, 63 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum ego quidem sciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quom scibitur, per urbem irridebor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars earum rerum est, quae sciuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an nihil certum sciri possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 51, 222</bibl></cit>: id de Marcello aut certe de Postumiā sciri potest, <hi rend="ital">can be learned from Marcellus</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 22, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42976.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or more freq. with <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui uti sciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sciret regibus uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam declamare sciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si docere sciant et velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digredi a re et redire ad propositum suum scierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vincere scis, Hannibal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nec ipse consulere nec alteri parere sciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 29, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tegere liberos sciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 53, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 52, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio, fortunas secundas neglegentiam prendere solere, Cato ap. Fest, s.v. parsi, p. 210: dii sciunt, culpam meam istanc non esse ullam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio, tibi ita placere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:30:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 30, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (leges) scitis exstare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: scimus L. Atilium appellatum esse sapientem <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scis, In breve te cogi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: scire licet, nobis venas et sanguen ... alienigenis ex partibus esse, <hi rend="ital">it is easy to see that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:860" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 860</bibl> (shortly before and after, scilicet); so, <cit><quote lang="la">scire licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 894</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:930" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 930</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:967" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 967</bibl>; 3, 873 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 39, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 2 al.</bibl>—So, in familiar style, <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi> scito, <hi rend="ital">be assured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I reply that</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remember</hi>, etc.: fenestrarum angustias quod reprehendis, scito te <foreign lang="greek">*ku/rou paidei/an</foreign> reprehendere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 21, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scito hoc nos in eo judicio consecutos esse, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 20, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">istis contumeliis scitote Q. Lollium coactum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 56, § 129</bibl>.—Esp., introducing a conclusion, after <hi rend="ital">si</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nisi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si venturus es, scito necesse esse te venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin ista pax perditum hominem restitutura est, hoc animo scito omnis sanos, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vos semel finem legis transieritis, scitote vos nullum ceteris in aestimando finem improbitatis reliquisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:95:section=220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 95, § 220</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 30, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 23</bibl>.—Rarely in <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi> (postAug.; cf. <pos>P. a.</pos>, infra): <cit><quote lang="la">interrogant an vir daturus sit beneficium ingrato, sciens ingratum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:26:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laqueo vitam finiit, sciens et in Maximino multum esse roboris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> in Max. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam hereditatem sciens ad se non pertinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:144" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 144</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc scitis omnes, usque adeo hominem in periculo fuisse, quoad scitum sit, Sestium vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 38, 82</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, with <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christus scitur vocis simplicis jussione ambulatum dedisse contractis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42976.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti jam sciunt, negotii quid sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sciamus, quid dicamus mox pro testimonio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scin' quam iracundus siem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuivis facile scitu est, quam fuerim miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sciatis, quo quaeque res inclinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 25, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sestium quanti faciam, ipse optime scio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tribus istis modis rerum publicarum velim scire quod optimum judices,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eum (hostem) non modo esse, sed etiam, quis et unde sit, scire possimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coqua est haec quidem: Scit muriatica ut maceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:42 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 42 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire velis, mea cur opuscula lector Laudet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quī scis, an, quae jubeam, sine vi faciat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 462</bibl>; cf. the phrase haud scio an, under an.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc sciri potuit, Quo studio vitam suam te absente exegerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: scito ... nec, <pb n="1644" /> <cb n="SCIO" /> quando futura sint comitia, sciri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 11, 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi> (ante-class.): <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Scio, quid ago. <hi rend="ital">Pi.</hi> Et pol ego scio, quid metuo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 45</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scitin' quid ego vos rogo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scis tu, ut confringi vas cito Samium solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ego ex hoc, ut factum est, scibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 57</bibl></cit>; instead of which, with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex me primo prima scires, rem ut gessissem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc scibo quid siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42976.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam vero de legibus, de bello, de pace ... scisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:13:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 13, 58</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi sciunt, qui hic affuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom videbis, tum scies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Pi.</hi> Quī scire possum? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Nullus plus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem, ut scitis, unice dilexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ut scitis, parenthetically,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 21</bibl></cit>; 2, 31, 54; 6, 9, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 77</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">scio alone, parenthetically: injurato scio plus credet mihi quam jurato tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego abeo: tu jam scio patiere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam tu propediem effliges scio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">scire tuum nihil est, nisi te scire hoc sciat alter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:27" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo ex me scibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non opus est dicto ... at scito huic opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus, quam opus est scito, sciet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; so, with <pos>adv.</pos> or <hi rend="ital">adverb.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam praeclarum est scire Latine, quam turpe nescire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 37, 140</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Latine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luculenter Graece,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graece,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi hanc forma videt honesta virginem, Et fidibus scire,</quote> <trans><tr>and that she was skilled in music</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit> (cf.: docere aliquem fidibus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discere fidibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 26</bibl></cit>).—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de legibus instituendis, de bello, de pace, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:13:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 13, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is, qui de omnibus scierit, de Sullā se scire negavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 13, 39</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">non</hi> (very rare for nescio; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non scire barbarum jam videtur, nescire dulcius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 157</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim erat qui non sciret studiosiorem Mithridatem fuisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 25, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam imperitus, ut non sciret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid? non sciunt ipsi viam, domum quā veniant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 27, 37</bibl>; Treb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:11:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 11, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42976.7" n="b" level="4"> Ellipt.: scin' quomodo? <hi rend="ital">do you know how</hi> (I shall serve you)? a threatening phrase in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 18</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n42976.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of a woman, <hi rend="ital">to know carnally</hi> a man (cf. of a man, cognosco), Treb. xxx. Tyr. 30.—* </sense><sense id="n42976.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, publicists' t. t. for the usual scisco (v. h. v. II.), of the people, <hi rend="ital">to ordain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint</hi> any thing after knowledge obtained regarding it: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tribunus plebis rogationem ferret sciretque plebs, uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 33, 10</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a scire for asciscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 80</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">knowing</hi>, i. e. </sense><sense id="n42976.10" n="A" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">knowingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wittingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purposely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intentionally</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.): tu verbis conceptis conjuravisti sciens sciente animo tuo, Scip. Afric. minor ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:11:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 11, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi verbis conceptis sciens libenter perjuraris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amore ardeo et prudens, sciens, Vivus vidensque pereo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; so (with prudens) Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 9</bibl>, A, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem plus hodie boni Feci imprudens, quam sciens ante hunc diem umquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 40</bibl></cit>; so (opp. imprudens) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 16, 41</bibl>; (opp. insciens) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebit igitur te sciente et vidente curia senatorem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 46, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ille me tentat sciens?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">heia vero, inquit, geram morem vobis et me oblinam sciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:5:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.—So the formula: si sciens fallo; v. fallo.—</sense><sense id="n42976.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquainted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versed</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">expert in</hi> any thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n42976.12" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ego jam nunc tibi renuntio, ut sis sciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me non scientem feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Ter Heaut. 4, 8, 32: vites pampinari: sed a sciente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis igitur hoc homine scientior umquam fuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientior venefica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:72" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (navis) scientissimo gubernatore utitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 58</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: sit oportet idem scientissimus,<cb n="SCIR" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42976.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominum scientem esse oportet earum rerum, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinae linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 70</bibl></cit>; 6, 26 et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Scaurus, vir regendae rei publicae scientissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 214</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 2, 13</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n42976.14" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis non alius flectere equum sciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭenter</orth> (acc. to B.), <hi rend="ital">knowingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understandingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expertly</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">scienter et perite et ornate dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti (with modice),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 29, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese distribuunt in duas partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 55</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem in eo genere scientius versatum Isocrate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:52:175" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 52, 175</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coepit rationem hujus operis (sphaerae) scientissime Gallus exponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 41, 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sciolus: <entryFree id="n42977" type="main" key="sci^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scius</etym>, <sense id="n42977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smatterer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sciolist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 86</bibl> dub.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 48, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">58, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">125, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sciopodes: <entryFree id="n42978" type="main" key="Sci^o^po^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scĭŏpŏdes</orth>, v. Sciapodes.</entryFree>
sciothericon: <entryFree id="n42979" type="greek" key="sci^o^the_ri^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭŏthērĭcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skioqhriko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n42979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sun-dial</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 76, 78, § 187</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭŏthērum</orth> (<foreign lang="greek">skio/qhron</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Limit. p. 175" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Limit. p. 175</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
scipiades: <entryFree id="n42980" type="main" key="Sci_pi^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scīpĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 2. Scipio, 2.</entryFree>
scipio: <entryFree id="n42981" type="greek" key="sci_pi^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scīpĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root skap-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skh/ptw,</foreign> to support, <foreign lang="greek">ski/pwn</foreign>, = <foreign lang="greek">skh=ptron,</foreign> a staff; cf.: scāpus, scopio, scamnum</etym>, <sense id="n42981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a staff</hi> (carried by persons of wealth, rank, high official station, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">unde ornatu hoc advenis? quid fecisti scipione?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eburneus, carried by the viri triumphales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl>; in the time of the emperors, also by the consuls, Val. Imp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 13</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin. ;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 15</bibl>; given as a present from the Roman nation to friendly princes; <cit><quote lang="la">so to Masinissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">to Eumenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42982" type="main" key="Sci_pi^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scīpĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. scipio</etym>, <sense id="n42982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a celebrated family in the</hi> gens Cornelia, the most famous members of which were the two conquerors of the Carthaginians, P. Cornelius Scipio Africanus major, in the second, and P. Cornelius Scipio Aemilianus Africanus minor, in the third Punic war. —In hexameter verse scanned <case>nom.</case> Scīpĭŏ, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 658</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:548" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 548</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:427" default="NO">10, 427</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:386" default="NO">13, 386</bibl>; 13, 449 al.; cf., in the foll., 3. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42982.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scīpĭōnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Scipios</hi> (late Lat.), Fab. Cl. Gord. Fulg. Act. Mundi, 11, p. 141.—</sense><sense id="n42982.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scīpĭŏnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Scipione quidam male dicunt Scipioninos: nam est Scipionarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=71" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 71</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n42982.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scīpĭădes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-as</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 582</bibl> P), <hi rend="ital">one of the Scipio family</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Scipio</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for Scipio, the oblique cases of which could not stand in hexameter verse): <cit><quote lang="la">Scipiadas, belli fulmen, Carthaginis horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1034" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1034</bibl></cit>; v. Lachm. ad h. 1.; Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. scurrae, p. 294 Müll.; <case>nom.</case> Scipiades, Claud. III. Cons. Stil. praef. 1; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>dat.</case> Scipiadae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11:59" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11, 59</bibl> (4, 10, 67); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 141</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Scipiadem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 17</bibl>; v. Heind. and Duntz. ad h. 1.; <hi rend="ital">plur. nom.</hi> Scipiadae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 790</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 381</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Scipiadum, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Seren. 42</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Scipiadas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 170</bibl>; Claud. ap. Prop. et Olybr. 149.</sense></entryFree>
scipionarius: <entryFree id="n42983" type="main" key="Sci_pi^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scīpĭōnārĭus</orth>, v. 2. Scipio, 2.</entryFree>
scipioneus: <entryFree id="n42984" type="main" key="Sci_pi^o_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scīpĭōnĕus</orth>, v. 2. Scipio, 1.</entryFree>
scirerytis: <entryFree id="n42985" type="main" key="sci_re^ry^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scīrĕrytis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n42985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of silver dross</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
