sciron: <entryFree id="n42986" type="main" key="Sci_ron1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scīron</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ski/rwn</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">*skei/rwn</foreign>). <sense id="n42986.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A noted robber on the rocky coast between Megaris and Attica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroyed by Theseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:444 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 444 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:333" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 333</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:21:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 253</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n42986.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scīrōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Sciron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Scironic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1225" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1225</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, rupes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 188</bibl></cit> (cf. also: <cit><quote lang="la">infames Scirone petras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:333" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 333</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n42986.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scī-rōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Scironic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">petrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1023" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1023</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n42986.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A north-west wind blowing from the Scironic rocks;</hi> so called by the Athenians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 120</bibl> (Jahn, Sciron); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:17:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 17, 4</bibl>. <cb n="SCIS" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n42987" type="main" key="Sci_ron2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scīron</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n42987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Epicurean philosopher in Cicero's time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia meminit Sciron Epicuri dogmata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scirpeus: <entryFree id="n42988" type="main" key="scirpe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scirpĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sirp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>scirpus</etym>. <sense id="n42988.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of rushes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rush-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: clava, Nov. ap. Fest. s. v. scirpus, p. 330 Müll.: simulacra, i. e. <hi rend="ital">images of men made of rushes</hi>, which were thrown into the Tiber annually, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:622" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 622</bibl> (v. Argei); <cit><quote lang="la">also imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:659" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 659</bibl></cit>: fila, <hi rend="ital">a rush-wick</hi> of wax tapers, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiscella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42988.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scirpĕa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sirp-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a basket-work of rushes to form the body of a wagon</hi> (generally used for carrying manure), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=139" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 139</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:680" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 680</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2</bibl>, n. 38.</sense></entryFree>
scirpiculus: <entryFree id="n42989" type="main" key="scirpi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scirpĭcŭlus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sirp-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">surp-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n42989.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made of rushes.</hi> So with falces (their use is unknown), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:22:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 22, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 137</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">fiscella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n42989.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scirpĭcŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sirp-, surp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a basket made of rushes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rush-basket</hi>: surpiculi olerorum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 490, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 10</bibl>; Col. poët. 10, 305; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 40: <cit><quote lang="la">piscarii,</quote> <trans><tr>wears</tr>, <tr>weels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scirpo: <entryFree id="n42990" type="main" key="scirpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scirpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sirpo</orth>), no <sense id="n42990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to plait of rushes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=137 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 137 sq.</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 83, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scirpula: <entryFree id="n42991" type="main" key="scirpu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scirpŭla</orth> <itype>vitis</itype>, <sense id="n42991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vine</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 41</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scirpus: <entryFree id="n42992" type="main" key="scirpus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scirpus</orth> (sometimes <orth extent="full" lang="la">sirpus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n42992.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bulrush</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 70, § 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:206" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 56, 57, § 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=330" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 330</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 8, 11</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n42992.1" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: nodum in scirpo quaerere, <hi rend="ital">to seek a knot in a bulrush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to find a difficulty where there is none</hi>: quaerunt in scirpo, soliti quod dicere, nodum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=330" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 330</bibl> (Sat. v. 46 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">in scirpo nodum quaeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">no dum in scirpo quaeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n42992.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, deriving the idea of intricacy from plaited work of rushes, <hi rend="ital">a riddle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enigma</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae Graeci dicunt aenigmata, hoc genus quidam e nostris veteribus scirpos appellaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scirros: <entryFree id="n42993" type="main" key="scirros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scirros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ski/rros</foreign>, <sense id="n42993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hard swelling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tumor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scirrosis: <entryFree id="n42994" type="main" key="scirro_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scirrōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ski/rrwsis</foreign>, <sense id="n42994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hardening in the flesh</hi>, = saxitas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:4:49" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 4, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sciscitatio: <entryFree id="n42995" type="main" key="scisci^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sciscĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sciscitor</etym>, <sense id="n42995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an asking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquiry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentissima sciscitatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sciscitator: <entryFree id="n42996" type="main" key="scisci^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sciscĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n42996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inquirer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examiner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigator</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">urinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minutissimus artium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sciscito: <entryFree id="n42997" type="main" key="scisci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sciscĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. sciscitor <sense id="n42997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sciscitor: <entryFree id="n42998" type="main" key="scisci^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sciscĭtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n42998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [scisco], <hi rend="ital">to inform one's self; to ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">question</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interrogate</hi>, etc. (class.; syn.: percontor, interrogo); constr. regularly, <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> (<hi rend="ital">ab</hi>) <hi rend="ital">aliquo aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">de aliquā re</hi>, with a <hi rend="ital">rel.clause</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> also (post-Aug.) with <hi rend="ital">aliquem quid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42998.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicuri ex Velleio sciscitabar sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:7:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam ex aliquo (with requirere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id sciscitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulis voluntatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26</bibl></cit>. consilium ejus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia ducum sciscitando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores naturasque hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42998.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de victoriă sciscitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de unoquoque nostrum sciscitantur omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Domitio, ut facis, sciscitare, ubi sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 15, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42998.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">an indirect question</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubet prius sciscitari quid sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 56</bibl>; 2, 12 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 17 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab utroque sciscitor, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42998.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">elicuit comiter sciscitando, ut fateretur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si de vetere jure discendum esset, issem plane sciscitatum ad istos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:13:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Aliquem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciscitatum deos descendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mane singulos, anne jentassent, sciscitaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 15</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n42998.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form: <cit><quote lang="la">paucula etiam sciscitare prius volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1645" /> <cb n="SCIS" /> —</sense><sense id="n42998.6" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sciscĭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium sententiis occultius sciscitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scisco: <entryFree id="n42999" type="main" key="scisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scisco</orth>, <itype>scīvi, scītum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n42999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sciscor</orth>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 799</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">v. inch. a.</hi> [scio], <hi rend="ital">to seek to know; to search</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquire.</hi> </sense><sense id="n42999.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (ante-class. and very rare; cf., on the other hand, the deriv. sciscitor): praefestinamus, quae sit causa, sciscere, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 186</bibl> P.: ibo ad eam, ut sciscam, quid velint, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 505, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n42999.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n42999.3" n="A" level="2"> Publicists' t. t., of the people, after inquiry or examination, <hi rend="ital">to accept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assent to</hi> something proposed; hence, <hi rend="ital">to appoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordain</hi>, = rem cognitam jubere (cf. sancio): <cit><quote lang="la">nullam illi (majores nostri) vim contionis esse voluerunt: quae scisceret plebes aut quae populus juberet summota contione, distributis partibus ... auditis auctoribus, re multos dies promulgatā et cognitā, juberi vetarique voluerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa legitima: consules populum jure rogaverunt populusque jure scivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationes plurimas propter vos populus scivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationem Marciam de Liguribus magno consensu plebes scivit jussitque. Ex eo plebiscito, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo id gratum plebi fuit ut id modo sciscerent juberentque, ut senatus decerneret, qui Romae regnaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sciscendum plebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Gaditani sciverint nominatim de aliquo cive Romano, ut sit is civis Gaditanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 11, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Athenienses) sciverunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 11, 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa perniciose sciscuntur in populis (with sancire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud stultissimum, existimare omnia justa esse, quae scita sint in populorum institutis aut legibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 42</bibl></cit> (v. also under <pos>P. a.</pos>).—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera Martis Aequent imperio et solem concedere nocti Sciscant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:545" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 545</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42999.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. (like decerno), of an individual, <hi rend="ital">to approve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assent to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vote for</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ulteriorem (Galliam decernit), ostendit, eam se sciscere legem, quam esse legem neget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod primus scivit legem de publicanis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 14, 35</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n42999.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To learn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascertain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">know</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illi id factum sciscerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: praefestinamus quae sit causa sciscere, quod, etc., Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 2, p. 186</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. v. 396 Rib.). —</sense><sense id="n42999.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of nature, <hi rend="ital">to decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">establish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confirmat antem illud vel maxime quod ipsa natura, ut ait ille, sciscet et probet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">scī-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n42999.7" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I.) Mid. (orig., that has informed himself, obtained knowledge, had experience; hence), <hi rend="ital">knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrewd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experienced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adroit</hi>, etc. (of persons; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic., but cf. 2.; syn.: callidus, versatus): doctu', fidelis ... Scitus, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 251 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominem astutum, doctum, scitum et callidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier scita atque prudens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: scitus agaso, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=330" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 330</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 217 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sycophanta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivator,</quote> <trans><tr>a clever</tr>, <tr>dexterous host</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scitus bellum (venereum) init,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea mulieris scitae comitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sum scitior, quae hos rogem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nessus scitus vadorum,</quote> <trans><tr>acquainted with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thalia lyrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sthenelus pugnandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 10</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">scitus accendere corda Laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:293" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accendere Martem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:594" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 594</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42999.8" n="b" level="4"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judicious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witty</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcre scripsti: scitum syngraphum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scito illa quidem (scripsit) sermone et Attico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">interrogationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 28</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio optima et scitissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid (dictum) est, quod mihi scitum esse videatur et homini ingenuo dignum atque docto, non aspernor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 14, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoris dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 20</bibl></cit>.—Esp. in the phrase scitum est, <hi rend="ital">it is a witty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">acute saying; shrewd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clever</hi>: vetus illud Catonis admodum scitum est, qui mirari se aiebat, quod non rideret haruspex, haruspicem cum vidisset, Cic. <cb n="SCIS" /> Div. 2, 24, 51; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scitum est illud Catonis, ut multa: Melius, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 90</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Scytharum legati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scitum est, inter Protogenem et eum (Apellem) quod accidit,</quote> <trans><tr>a clever thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc Scitum est, periculum ex aliis facere, tibi quod ex usu siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scitum est causam conferre in tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 228</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42999.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, etc. (mostly ante- and post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: venustus, bellus): satis scitum filum mulieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Iphis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 63, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierculae formae scitioris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (v. perscitus): <cit><quote lang="la">vox admodum scita et canora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec nox scita'st exercendo scorto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. scitamenta.—</sense><sense id="n42999.10" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II. A.) <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scītum</orth>, i. <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an ordinance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decree;</hi> esp. in connection with plebis (plebei, v. plebs), or, in one word, plebiscitum, <hi rend="ital">an ordinance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decree of the people</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of the citizens</hi> (opp. to senatusconsultum, a decree of the Senate): <cit><quote lang="la">scita plebei appellantur ea, quae plebs suo suffragio sine patribus jussit, plebeio magistratu rogante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=293" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 293</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Lael. Felix ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo plebiscito decreta a senatu est quaestio, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (lex) postea plebiscito Canuleio abrogata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebiscitis consularem potestatem minuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 199</bibl></cit> et saep. (v. 2. scitus).—In a lusus verbb. with scitus, A.: <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Ecquid is homo scitus est? <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Plebiscitum non est scitius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 58</bibl>.—In the order scitum plebis: <cit><quote lang="la">de altero aedile scitum plebis est factum rogantibus tribunis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scita plebis injuncta patribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:26" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 26</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Populi is used instead of plebis when the decrees of other nations are spoken of: cum lex esset Athenis, ne quis populi scitum faceret, ut quisquam coronā donaretur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenienses quibusdam temporibus sublato Areopago nihil nisi populi scitis ac decretis agebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:27:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 27, 43</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in one word, populiscitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nullum de eā re scitum populi fieret aut litteris mandaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 25</bibl></cit>. Tacitus is the first who has populi scita for <hi rend="ital">decrees of the Roman people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 58</bibl>.—Of Roman <hi rend="ital">popular decrees</hi> also simply scita: <cit><quote lang="la">cum scita ac jussa nostra sua sententia comprobat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 18, 42</bibl></cit>.—Rarely of other public or official ordinances (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decreta, edicta, jussa): (Numa) omnia publica privataque sacra Pontificis scitis subjecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo minus ferociter aliorum (decemvirorum) scitis adversarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n42999.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (with decretum and placitum) as a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">do/gma,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a maxim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dogma</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scītē</orth> (acc. to A.), <hi rend="ital">shrewdly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleverly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">skilfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adroitly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nicely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tastefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegantly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">eho, nimium scite scitus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tondetur nimium scite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis scite et probe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 16, 1</bibl> (with commode): <cit><quote lang="la">(rationes) ita sunt perscriptae scite et litterate, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scite et venuste facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:35:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 35, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa ex patellis quae evellerat, ita scite in aureis poculis inligabat, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">54: non scite (dictum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 48, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scite loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum scite convivium exornare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scitius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scitissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:11:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 212, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scissilis: <entryFree id="n43000" type="main" key="scissi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scissĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scindo</etym>. <sense id="n43000.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That may easily be split</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleft</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43000.1" n="II" level="1"> (Postclass.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">scissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">rent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palliastrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">centunculus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, p. 222, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 47, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scissim: <entryFree id="n43001" type="main" key="scissim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scissim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by rending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleaving</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dividing</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Enchir. Vet. Test. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scissio: <entryFree id="n43002" type="main" key="scissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cleaving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dividing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scission</hi> of a number (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Amos, 6, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scissis: <entryFree id="n43003" type="main" key="Scissis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scissis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">probably in the territory of the Lacetani</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> <cb n="SCOL" /></sense></entryFree>
scissor: <entryFree id="n43004" type="main" key="scissor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scissor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scinde</etym>. <sense id="n43004.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who cleaves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a carver</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 36, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43004.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of gladiator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2569</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scissura: <entryFree id="n43005" type="main" key="scissu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scissūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rending</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dividing; a rent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scissure</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n43005.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad scissuram Nili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:100" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 28, 34, § 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal rectis scissuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mai, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 9, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43005.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">domestica turbat rem populi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 756</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audio scissuras esse inter vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 11, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scissus: <entryFree id="n43006" type="main" key="scissus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of scindo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43007" type="gloss" key="scissus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scissus</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">sxi/sma,</foreign> <sense id="n43007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleft</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
scitamenta: <entryFree id="n43008" type="main" key="sci_ta_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scītāmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. scitus, A. 2.</etym>. <sense id="n43008.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Delicate food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dainties</hi> (ante- and postclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 26</bibl>: Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:9:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 245</bibl>. —* </sense><sense id="n43008.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of figures of speech, <hi rend="ital">niceties</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prettinesses</hi>: '<foreign lang="greek">*omoiote/leuta ... kai\ o(moio/ptwta</foreign> ceteraque hujusmodi scitamenta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scitatio: <entryFree id="n43009" type="hapax" key="sci_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scītātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scitor</etym>, <sense id="n43009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an asking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquiring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indefessa scitatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scite: <entryFree id="n43010" type="main" key="sci_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scītē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. scisco, <sense id="n43010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scitor: <entryFree id="n43011" type="main" key="sci_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scītor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (old <sense id="n43011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> scitarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 741</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. freq. dep. a.</hi> [scio], <hi rend="ital">to seek to know; to ask</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquire</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16, 52</bibl>, read sciscitari; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogo, percunctor): scitari et quaerere causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam viae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 511</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam adventūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:741" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 741</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:548" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digna relatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:793" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 793</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scitanti deus huic de conjuge dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:564" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 564</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid veniat, scitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:622" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurypylum scitatum oracula Phoebi Mittimus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to consult</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt quae ex te solo scitari volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ex aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to ask</tr>, <tr>inquire</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:775" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 775</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 357</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulta numinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scitari, quid molirentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scitule: <entryFree id="n43012" type="main" key="sci_tu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scītŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. scitulus <sense id="n43012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scitulus: <entryFree id="n43013" type="main" key="sci_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scītŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n43013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. scitus, A. 2.], <hi rend="ital">handsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegant</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma atque aetatula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, 113, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem formulae scitulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 136, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caupona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, p. 105, 23: <cit><quote lang="la">pusiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 179</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scītŭlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">elegantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gracefully</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>, p. 192, 35; 10, p. 253, 38.</sense></entryFree>
scitum: <entryFree id="n43014" type="main" key="sci_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>scisco</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, A. 1. and B.</entryFree>
scitus: <entryFree id="n43015" type="main" key="sci_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of scisco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43016" type="main" key="sci_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scisco</etym>, with plebi, for the more usual plebiscitum, <sense id="n43016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a decree</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ordinance of the people</hi>: neque populi jussu neque plebi scitu, Vet. Decr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia deinde de senatūs sententiā plebique scitu sunt habita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sciurus: <entryFree id="n43017" type="greek" key="sci^u_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ski/ouros,</foreign> <sense id="n43017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a squirrel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 38, 58, § 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:245" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 43, 99, § 245</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 37, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scius: <entryFree id="n43018" type="main" key="sci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scio</etym>, <sense id="n43018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having knowledge</hi> of a thing (mostly ante- and post-class., and rare for sciens, gnarus, peritus). </sense><sense id="n43018.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: neque quemquam invenit scium, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 634</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres plus sciae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 63, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puto eos prudentes et scios mendacia defendenda suscipere,</quote> <trans><tr>knowingly</tr>, <tr>wittingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 21, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43018.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinae linguae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
scobina: <entryFree id="n43019" type="main" key="sco^bi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏbīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scobis</etym>, <sense id="n43019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rasp</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=68" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 68</bibl>; Plaut. Fragm. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 68, § 180</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scobis: <entryFree id="n43020" type="main" key="sco^bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏbis</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">scobs</orth>, only acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 751</bibl> P.; but scobis is found in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:4" default="NO">7, 10, 4</bibl>; cf. scrobis <sense id="n43020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 17, 6</bibl>) [scabo], <hi rend="ital">powder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dust produced by sawing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rasping</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">sawdust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrapings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filings</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 26, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:67 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 67 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">citreus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>grated lemon-peel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: cutis, <hi rend="ital">scurf</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 10, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scodra: <entryFree id="n43021" type="main" key="Scodra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scodra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Dalmatia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Scutari</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on Lake Labeatis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:32" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 144</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scodrenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Scodra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scodrus: <entryFree id="n43022" type="main" key="Scodrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scodrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Scordus.</entryFree>
scola: <entryFree id="n43023" type="main" key="sco^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏla</orth>, v. schola.</entryFree>
scolecia: <entryFree id="n43024" type="greek" key="sco_le_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scōlēcĭa</orth>, v. scolex. <pb n="1646" /> <cb n="SCOP" /></entryFree>
scolecion: <entryFree id="n43025" type="greek" key="sco_le_ci^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scōlēcĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skwlh/kion,</foreign> <sense id="n43025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of scarlet berry</hi> (which is apt to be wormeaten), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 4, 4, § 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scolex: <entryFree id="n43026" type="main" key="sco_lex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scōlex</orth>, <itype>lēcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skw/lhc,</foreign> <sense id="n43026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of copper rust with the appearance of being worm-eaten</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 28, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scolibrochon: <entryFree id="n43027" type="greek" key="sco^li^bro^chon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏlĭbrŏchon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skoli/broxon,</foreign> <sense id="n43027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> callitrichos, scolopendrion, <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Capillus Veneris, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scolopax: <entryFree id="n43028" type="greek" key="sco^lo_pax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏlōpax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skolw/pac,</foreign> <sense id="n43028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a snipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">woodcock</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Fragm. Aucup. 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scolopendra: <entryFree id="n43029" type="greek" key="sco^lo^pendra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏlŏpendra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skolo/pendra.</foreign> <sense id="n43029.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of multipede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scolopendra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 29, 43, § 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43029.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sea-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 43, 67, § 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scolopendrion: <entryFree id="n43030" type="greek" key="sco^lo^pendri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏlŏpendrĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skolope/ndrion</foreign>, <sense id="n43030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> callitrochon <hi rend="ital">and</hi> scolibrochon, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scolos: <entryFree id="n43031" type="main" key="Sco_los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scōlos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*skw=los,</foreign> <sense id="n43031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:266" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 266</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scolymos: <entryFree id="n43032" type="greek" key="sco^ly^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏlymos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sko/lumos</foreign>, <sense id="n43032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an edible kind of thistle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carāoon</hi>: Cynara cardunculus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 99, § 262</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 16, 56, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:86" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 43, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scomber: <entryFree id="n43033" type="greek" key="scomber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scomber</orth>, <itype>bri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sko/mbros,</foreign> <sense id="n43033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of tunny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mackerel</hi>: Scomber scomber, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 19, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:94" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 8, 43, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:95:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 95, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:43" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:50:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 50, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:87:8" default="NO">4, 87, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:102:2" default="NO">13, 102, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scomma: <entryFree id="n43034" type="greek" key="scomma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scomma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skw=mma</foreign>, <sense id="n43034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a teasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taunting expression; a taunt</hi>,<hi rend="ital">jeer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cavil</hi> (late Lat. for convicium, maledictum), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scopa: <entryFree id="n43035" type="main" key="sco_pa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scōpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scōpae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (cf. on <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 7</bibl> Müll.; 10, § 24 ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 20</bibl> P.; 72 ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 315</bibl> ib.; <number>sing.</number>, <sense id="n43035.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, B.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root skap-, to support; cf.: scipio, scamnum</etym>. </sense><sense id="n43035.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">thin branches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twigs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoots</hi> (rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 152</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 24, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 12</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 47, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 89, § 241</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:46 al" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 18, 21, § 46 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43035.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scō-pa rēgĭa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a species of the goosefoot</hi>: Chenopodium scoparia, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 15, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:44" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 19, § 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43035.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a broom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besom</hi> made of twigs (class. in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">munditias volo fieri: efferte huc scopas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopis mundata,</quote> <trans><tr>swept</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scopā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 14, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43035.4" n="b" level="4"> Prov.: scopas dissolvere, <hi rend="ital">to untie a broom</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to throw any thing into disorder</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confusion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:235" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 235</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, scopae solutae, of a man in utter perplexity,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 13</bibl></cit>, b, 6.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43036" type="main" key="sco^pa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skoph/,</foreign> <sense id="n43036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a speculation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theory</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 812</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scoparius: <entryFree id="n43037" type="main" key="sco_pa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scōpārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scopa, II.</etym>, <sense id="n43037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sweeper</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scopas: <entryFree id="n43038" type="main" key="Sco^pas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scŏpas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sko/pas.</foreign> <sense id="n43038.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous Grecian sculptor of Paros</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who flourished between the</hi> 97<hi rend="ital">th and</hi> 105<hi rend="ital">th Olympiads</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:39:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 39, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43038.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A very rich Thessalian in the time of Simonides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 352</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 14</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 24</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
scopelismos: <entryFree id="n43039" type="greek" key="sco^pe^lismos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏpĕlismos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, also written as Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skopelismo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n43039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crime said to be practised in Arabia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where a man places stones in his enemy's field</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as a threat that whoever shall dare cultivate it shall be slain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res tantum timorem habet, ut nemo ad eum agrum accedere audeat, crudelitatem timens eorum qui scopelismon fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scopes: <entryFree id="n43040" type="greek" key="sco_pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scōpes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skw=pes,</foreign> <sense id="n43040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of owl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 49, 70, § 138</bibl>; from Hom. Od. 5, 66.</sense></entryFree>
scopio: <entryFree id="n43041" type="main" key="sco^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏpĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root skap-; cf.: scamnum, scipio</etym>, <sense id="n43041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the stalk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pedicle of grapes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 112, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:46" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:3" default="NO">12, 39, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:43:10" default="NO">12, 43, 10</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏpĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 54, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:4:17" default="NO">2, 4, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scopo: <entryFree id="n43042" type="main" key="sco^po1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏpo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> <etym><foreign lang="greek">skope/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n43042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to investigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">test</hi>, <hi rend="ital">search</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:76:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 76, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43043" type="main" key="sco_po2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scōpo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. scopa, II.</etym>, <sense id="n43043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to brush</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sweep away</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 14, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scopos: <entryFree id="n43044" type="greek" key="sco^pos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏpos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skopo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n43044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim</hi> at which one shoots, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scopulae: <entryFree id="n43045" type="main" key="sco_pu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scōpŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. scopa, II.</etym>, <sense id="n43045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little broom</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 38, 4</bibl>; also in <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scōpŭla</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a broom-twig</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 18, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scopulosus: <entryFree id="n43046" type="main" key="sco^pu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏpŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scopulus</etym>, <sense id="n43046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of rocks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rocky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shelvy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">craggy</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11, 35</bibl></cit>: <cb n="SCOR" /> mare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:274" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 619</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pylene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:102" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 102</bibl></cit>: cete, <hi rend="ital">projecting</hi> like a rock, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 1, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:305" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 305</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rocky places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gangem dejectum per scopulosa et abrupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 18, 22, § 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43046.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga beluae,</quote> <trans><tr>projecting like rocks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:518" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 518</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scopulus: <entryFree id="n43047" type="main" key="sco^pu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏpŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sko/pelos,</foreign> <sense id="n43047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a projecting point of rock; a rock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cliff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crag</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a rock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shelf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ledge</hi> in the sea. </sense><sense id="n43047.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic., but <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, II.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes, cautes), in the sea: ut pars (remigum) ad scopulos allisa interficeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl>; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 524</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 592</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:246" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomentes aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 182</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of a promontory,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:419" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 419</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopuli errantes, of the Symplegades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:621" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 621</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:681" default="NO">4, 681</bibl>.—On land: <cit><quote lang="la">scopuli rupesque cavae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 253</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 445</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 531</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:263" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:665" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 665</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:632" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 632</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the cavern of Cacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulus Mavortis, of the Areopagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his inmobilior scopulis, of a man hard to move,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:801" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 801</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulis surdior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum et scopulos gestare in corde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus es e scopulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43047.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rock</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">a difficulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">danger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evil</hi>, etc. (freq. in Cic.; also commended by him as a figure): cum neque Musarum scopulos quisquam superarat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 76</bibl> (Ann. v. 223 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui te ad scopulum e tranquillo inferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syrtim patrimonii scopulum libentius dixerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tuas umquam rationes ad eos scopulos, appulisses, ad quos Sex. Titii afflictam navem et in quibus C. Deciani naufragium fortunarum videres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 9, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scopulos vitae incidere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Consol. Fragm. 2, p. 489</bibl></cit> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Piso et Gabinius) geminae voragines scopulique rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 18, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Pompeius) Ille tremor Ponti et piratarum scopulus, Petr. poët. 123, 240: commeatum publicum in scopulos annonae impingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus tribunal scopulus reorum dicebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e scopulo cadere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be ruined</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
