scopus: <entryFree id="n43048" type="greek" key="sco^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skopo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n43048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">target</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pueri procul stantis, praebentisque pro scopo dispansam dextrae manūs palmam, sagittas direxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 19</bibl></cit> (dub.; Roth, scopulo; cf. <foreign lang="greek">skopo/s,</foreign> in trop. sense, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11, 2</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
scordalia: <entryFree id="n43049" type="hapax" key="scorda^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scordălĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scordalus</etym>, <sense id="n43049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quarrel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrangling</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 59, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scordalus: <entryFree id="n43050" type="main" key="scorda^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scordălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quarrelsome fellow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wrangler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brawler</hi> (a low post-Aug. word), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 95, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:56:2" default="NO">56, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Suas. 7, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scordilon: <entryFree id="n43051" type="main" key="scordi^lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scordĭlon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. scordion.</entryFree>
scordion: <entryFree id="n43052" type="greek" key="scordi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scordĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sko/rdion,</foreign> <sense id="n43052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant that smells like garlic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">water - germander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scordium</hi>: Teucrium scordium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 27, § 63</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">scordŏtis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 27, § 63</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">scordĭlon</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scordisci: <entryFree id="n43053" type="main" key="Scordisci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scordisci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n43053.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people on the borders of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epit. 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43053.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people of Pannonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:3:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scordotis: <entryFree id="n43054" type="main" key="scordo^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scordŏtis</orth>, v. scordion.</entryFree>
scordus: <entryFree id="n43055" type="main" key="Scordus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scordus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 20, 1</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scodrus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scoria: <entryFree id="n43056" type="greek" key="sco_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skwri/a,</foreign> <sense id="n43056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoria</hi> of metals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:105" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 6, 35, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:107" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 11, 24, § 107</bibl>; 34, 18, 51, § 171; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scorpaena: <entryFree id="n43057" type="greek" key="scorpaena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scorpaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sko/rpaina,</foreign> <sense id="n43057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-scorpion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:162" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 51, 74, § 162</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scorpiacum: <entryFree id="n43058" type="greek" key="scorpi^a^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scorpĭăcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skorpiako/n</foreign>, <sense id="n43058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a remedy against the sting of a scorpion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
scorpinaca: <entryFree id="n43059" type="main" key="scorpi^na_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scorpĭnāca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> proserpinaca, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scorpio: <entryFree id="n43060" type="greek" key="scorpi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scorpĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> collat. forms <orth extent="full" lang="la">scorpĭus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, corresp. to the Greek), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skorpi/wn, skorpi/os,</foreign> <sense id="n43060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scorpion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43060.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 62, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:24" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 2, 5, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:91" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 29, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 8, 15</bibl>. <cb n="SCOR" /> —In the form scorpius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 371</bibl> scorpios, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 164</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> scorpion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:541" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 541</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43060.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43060.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Scorpion</hi>, one of the signs of the zodiac.—Form Scorpios, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 44, 113; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 208</bibl> and 430; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 196</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:26" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 26</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Scorpion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 83</bibl>.—Form Scorpio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scorpionis ascensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 34, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43060.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of prickly sea-fish</hi>: Cottus scorpio, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the form scorpios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:116" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43060.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A prickly plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorpion - wort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorpion - grass</hi>: Spartium scorpius, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 15, 17, § 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43060.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A shrub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> tragos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 116, § 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:116" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 21, 37, § 116</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43060.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A military engine for throwing darts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and other missiles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scorpion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 25</bibl>; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 553, 24</bibl> (Hist. 3, 36 Dietsch); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:49" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1</bibl>; in the form scorpius, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 553, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 6, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43060.8" n="F" level="1"> In the agrimensores, <hi rend="ital">a heap of stones terminating in a point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and used as a boundary-mark</hi>, Sic. Fl. pp. 4 and 6 Goes. —</sense><sense id="n43060.9" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An instrument of torture</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 5, 27, 18</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 12, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 10, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scorpioctonon: <entryFree id="n43061" type="greek" key="scorpi^octo^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scorpĭoctŏnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skorpiokto/non,</foreign> <sense id="n43061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the scorpion-killer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the heliotrope</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scorpion: <entryFree id="n43062" type="main" key="scorpi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scorpĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> thelyphonon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 75, § 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scorpionius: <entryFree id="n43063" type="main" key="scorpi^o_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scorpĭōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scorpio</etym>, <sense id="n43063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a scorpion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorpion-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus cucumeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 1, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scorpios: <entryFree id="n43064" type="main" key="scorpi^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scorpĭos</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. scorpio.</entryFree>
scorpitis: <entryFree id="n43065" type="greek" key="scorpi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scorpītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skorpi=tis,</foreign> <sense id="n43065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resembling the scorpion in color </hi> or <hi rend="ital">shape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 72, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scorpiurus: <entryFree id="n43066" type="greek" key="scorpi^u_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scorpĭūrus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-ūros</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 72</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skorpi/ouros,</foreign> <sense id="n43066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scorpion's-tail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of heliotrope</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 49</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">scorpĭūron</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 29, § 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scorpius: <entryFree id="n43067" type="main" key="scorpi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scorpĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. scorpio.</entryFree>
scortator: <entryFree id="n43068" type="main" key="scorta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scortātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scortor</etym>, <sense id="n43068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whoremonger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fornicator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Ephes. 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scortatus: <entryFree id="n43069" type="hapax" key="scorta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scortātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">whoredom</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 171, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scortes: <entryFree id="n43070" type="gloss" key="scortes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scortes</orth> <itype>id est pelles testium arietinorum a pellibus dicti</itype>, Fest. pp. 330 and 331 Müll. [scortum, I.].</entryFree>
scorteus: <entryFree id="n43071" type="main" key="scorte^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scortĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scortum, I.</etym>, <sense id="n43071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of hides</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leather</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leathern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam nunc dicimus scortea ea, quae ex corio ac pellibus sunt facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 84</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:629" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 629</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Fest. s. v. scorta, p. 330 Müll.: fascinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 138, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asses, Hier. Chron. ad annum MCCC.—In a lusus verbb.: scorteum scortum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wrinkled</tr>, <tr>old</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 105, 36</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scortĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. vestis), <hi rend="ital">a garment of skins</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leather</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:130" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 130</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 20, 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scortillum: <entryFree id="n43072" type="hapax" key="scortillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scortillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scortum, II.</etym>, <sense id="n43072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi> or <hi rend="ital">young harlot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 3</bibl>; cf. ‡ scortulum.</sense></entryFree>
scortor: <entryFree id="n43073" type="main" key="scortor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scortor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype> (old <sense id="n43073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> scortarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 58</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to employ</hi> or <hi rend="ital">associate with harlots</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">scortari est saepius meretriculam ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 84</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scortulum: <entryFree id="n43074" type="gloss" key="scortu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scortŭlum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">po/rnh,</foreign> Gloss. Vet. Lat. Gr.; cf. scortillum.</entryFree>
scortum: <entryFree id="n43075" type="main" key="scortum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scortum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xo/rion,</foreign> corium; Lith. skurà, skin</etym>. <sense id="n43075.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pellem antiqui dicebant scortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 84</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam Omphale in Herculis scorto designata descripsit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n43075.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a harlot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strumpet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostitute</hi> (freq. and class.): scorta appellantur meretrices, quia ut pelliculae subiguntur. Omnia namque ex pellibus facta scortea appellantur, Fest. pp. 330 and 331 Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 79</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:10:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 10, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:43 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 43 sq.</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 21, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10 al.</bibl>—Of <hi rend="ital">a male prostitute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 17, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">119, 25</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also, virile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 28" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 28</bibl></cit>.—And with a <pb n="1647" /> <cb n="SCRI" /> <hi rend="ital">masc. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scortum exoletum ne quis in proscenio Sedeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 17</bibl></cit> (cf. senium, II. A.).—Also = pellex, <hi rend="ital">a mistress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concubine</hi>, Plaut. Cas. Grex, 5 and 7.</sense></entryFree>
scoti: <entryFree id="n43076" type="main" key="Sco_ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scōti</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Scotti</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Scots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people in the northern part of Britain</hi>, in the mod. <hi rend="ital">Scotland</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">26, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jovin. 2, 7</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scotus, collect.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 417</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 251</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43076.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scō-tĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the land of the Scots</hi>, = Hibernia, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 14, 6, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43076.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scōtĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Scott-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Scotland</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Scottish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Scotch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 254</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scotia: <entryFree id="n43077" type="greek" key="sco^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">skoti/a</foreign>, in architect. <sense id="n43077.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hollow moulding in the base of a column</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43077.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A gutter at the end of a cornice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scoticus: <entryFree id="n43078" type="main" key="Sco_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Scoti <sense id="n43078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scotinus: <entryFree id="n43079" type="greek" key="Sco^ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scŏtīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*skoteino/s</foreign> (the Obscure), <sense id="n43079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Heraclitus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati ad Hannibalem missi Heraclitus, cui Scotino cognomen erat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 39, 3</bibl></cit> (v. Munro ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:639" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 639</bibl>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Heraclitus cui cognomen fecit orationis obscuritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 7</bibl></cit> (as Greek, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 15</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
scotoma: <entryFree id="n43080" type="greek" key="sco^to_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏtōma</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sko/twma</foreign>, <sense id="n43080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dimness of vision</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 4, 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scotomaticus: <entryFree id="n43081" type="greek" key="sco^to_ma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏtōmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">skotwmatiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n43081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to dimness of vision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">passio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scŏtōmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dim-sighted person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 99" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scotus: <entryFree id="n43082" type="main" key="Sco_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scōtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Scoti.</entryFree>
scotusa: <entryFree id="n43083" type="main" key="Sco^tu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scŏtūsa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scŏtussa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sko/tousa, *skotou=ssa.</foreign> <sense id="n43083.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Strymon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 42</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scŏtussaei</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Scotussa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43083.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Larissa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 9</bibl>; 36, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 14, § 17</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Scŏtūsaeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Scotuss-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Scotussa in Thessaly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
scrapta: <entryFree id="n43084" type="main" key="scrapta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrapta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">scratta</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrātĭa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrattĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of an unchaste woman</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 6</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 169, 8</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 65</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> and Titin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=333" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 333</bibl> ib. (Com. Rel. p. 124 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
screator: <entryFree id="n43085" type="hapax" key="scre^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrĕātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>screo</etym>, <sense id="n43085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hawker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hemmer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
screatus: <entryFree id="n43086" type="hapax" key="scre^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrĕātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hawking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hemming</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
screo: <entryFree id="n43087" type="hapax" key="scre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrĕo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n43087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hawk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scriba: <entryFree id="n43088" type="main" key="scri_ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrība</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scribo</etym>, <sense id="n43088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public</hi> or <hi rend="ital">official writer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a clerk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scribe</hi> (whereas librarius or scriba librarius denotes a private secretary or amanuensis; <cit><quote lang="la">notarius, a short-hand writer): scribas proprio nomine antiqui et librarios et poëtas vocabant. At nunc dicuntur scribae quidem librarii, qui rationes publicas scribunt in tabulis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=333" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 333</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">(scribarum) ordo est honestus, quod eorum hominum fidei tabellae publicae periculaque magistratuum committuntur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:79:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 79, § 183</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 78</bibl>, § 182; 2, 3, 80, § 184 sq.; 2, 3, 80, § 187; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 25, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:45:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 45, 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 32</bibl> (distinguished from librarii): <cit><quote lang="la">meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 2</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: SCRIBA AB EPISTOLIS LATINIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2437</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">SCRIBA LIBRARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1621</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2950 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43088.1" n="2" level="3"> (Eccl. Lat.) <hi rend="ital">A doctor of the Jewish law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one whose duty it was to guard and expound the sacred text</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 8, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 23, 2</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
scribatus: <entryFree id="n43089" type="hapax" key="scri_ba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrībātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scriba</etym>, <sense id="n43089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a scribe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">secretary; a clerkship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretaryship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad scribatum nominatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 62, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. 2. scriptus.</sense></entryFree>
scriblita: <entryFree id="n43090" type="main" key="scribli_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriblīta</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scribilīta</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of tart</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">66, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:17:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 17, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scriblitarius: <entryFree id="n43091" type="hapax" key="scriblita_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriblitārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scriblita</etym>, <sense id="n43091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tart-baker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pastry-cook</hi> (with pistor), Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 131, 27</bibl> (Com. Rel. p. 157 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
scribo: <entryFree id="n43092" type="main" key="scri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrībo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n43092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sync. scripsti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 57</bibl>: scripstis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 153, 28</bibl>, or Trag. v. 239 Vahl.; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> scripse, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Sept. Sap. Lud. 1</bibl>; cf. 2. dico <cb n="SCRI" /> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root skrabh-, to dig; whence, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gra/fw;</foreign> Lat. scrobis, scrofa; cf. Germ. schreiben</etym>, prop., to scratch, grave, engrave with a sharp point; hence, </sense><sense id="n43092.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n43092.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to write</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi>, or otherwise <hi rend="ital">make</hi> lines, letters, figures, etc. (cf. scalpo): <cit><quote lang="la">in libro cum scribuntur calamo litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 131</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:76 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 76 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras, tabellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(littera M) etiamsi scribitur, tamen parum exprimitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri praeceptores cervum servumque u et o litteris scripserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:20" default="NO">1, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:30" default="NO">1, 7, 30</bibl>; 12, 10, 28; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 10, 30: terra in augurum libris scripta cum r uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 21</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic carmen mediā scribe columnā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 83; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scribitur vestris Cynthia corticibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 18, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 527</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 343</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: fac lapis his scriptus stet super ossa notis: hic jacet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 54</bibl></cit> (but the better reading is inscriptis): <cit><quote lang="la">scribere decore,</quote> <trans><tr>to write a good hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat scriptum ipsius manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suā manu scripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 10</bibl></cit>.—Of drawing, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis fugitivo stigmata scripserit,</quote> <trans><tr>has branded a runaway</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: charaxat ambas ungulis scribentibus genas, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 557: <cit><quote lang="la">totius vobis Frontem tabernae scipionibus scribam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Diodotus Stoicus) geometriae munus tuebatur, verbis praecipiens discentibus, unde, quo quamque lineam scriberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut formam (porticus) secundum rationem loci scribas,</quote> <trans><tr>draw</tr>, <tr>design</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 39, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae Attalicis variata per artem Aulaeis scribuntur acu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are embroidered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:660" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripto radiat Germanicus auro, i. e. sculpto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:205" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 205</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:5:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43092.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: memor essem? etiam nunc mihi Scripta illa dicta sunt in animo Chrysidis De Glycerio, <hi rend="ital">graven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprinted</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">inscripta, insculpta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva sanguineo scribit rutilantia gyro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:514" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 514</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43092.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., with the accessory idea of intellectual action, of written composition of every kind, <hi rend="ital">to write</hi>, <hi rend="ital">write down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">describe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depict; to draw up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">communicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">announce in writing</hi> (syn.: compono, perscribo). </sense><sense id="n43092.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam de re publicā multa quaesierint et scripserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. Aufidius praetorius (caecus) Graecam scribebat historiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:38:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 38, 112</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">historiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:262" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75, 262</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res gestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum de rebus rusticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripsi etiam versibus tres libros de temporibus meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Catone Majore, qui est scriptus ad te de senectute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Furius defensionem causae suae scripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:43:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 43, § 112</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:61" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 13, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">notas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:2:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diphilus Hanc (fabulam) Graece scripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. prol. 6</bibl> (cf. also infra, <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf.: scripsere alii rem Versibus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 76</bibl> (Ann. v. 221 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">formam et situm agri alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to describe</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—Of written communications, letters, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulis tuis perdiligenter scriptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec scripsi properans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras, quas ad Pompeium scripsi, tibi misi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae extemplo Romam scriptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura ad te scribam, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriberem ad te de hoc plura, si Romae esses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad te scripsi verbosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptā jam epistulā superiore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quo haberem, quod tibi scriberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 4</bibl></cit>, a: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere salutem,</quote> <trans><tr>to send a greeting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 77</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes atque gratias populo Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—With a personal object: <cit><quote lang="la">nullos habeo scriptos (homines), memini tamen,</quote> <trans><tr>written down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per eum Marium, quem scripsissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 49, 1</bibl></cit>: quis Martem digne scripserit aut...Merionem aut...Tydiden? <hi rend="ital">who could depict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represent</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 16</bibl>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriberis Vario fortis et hostium Victor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—With two <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: cum auctor <cb n="SCRI" /> pugnae se A. Cornelium Cossum consulem scripserit, <hi rend="ital">subscribed himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declared himself in the inscription to be</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 20, 11</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43092.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foribus scribat occupatum esse se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Africanum avum meum scribit Cato solitum esse dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 8, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae quod scribis sileri, ita putabam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad te scripseram me in Epiro futurum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeceius ad me scripsit, C. Cassium sibi scripsisse, homines comparari, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero quodam loco scribit, id esse optimum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post paulo scribit, sibi millia quinque Esse domi chlamydum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 43</bibl></cit> et saep.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, with <case>nom.</case> or <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem haec avis scribitur conchis se solere complere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49, 125</bibl></cit>: scribitur nobis, magnam veteranorum multitudinem Romam convenisse jam, etc., Brut. et Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptum est item, quaesivisse (Socratem), quid esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 54, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43092.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec scribis, quam ad diem te exspectemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribe aliquando ad nos, quid agas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me Valerius scripsit... quem ad modum ducta esses, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43092.8" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (Platone) nemo in scribendo praestantior fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:11:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 11, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Demophilus scripsit, Marcus vortit barbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. prol. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. prol. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta quom primum ad scribendum animum appulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. prol. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumite materiem vestris, qui scribitis, aequam Viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic raro scribis, ut toto non quater anno Membranam poscas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Samiae, ut ibi (i. e. in oratione) scribit Laelius, capedines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:2:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quemadmodum scribit ille, cottidiano, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denique non video de tot scribentibus unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:495" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 495</bibl></cit>.—So freq. of written communications, letters; usually with <hi rend="ital">ad aliquem</hi> (less freq. <hi rend="ital">alicui</hi>) or <hi rend="ital">de aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tv si, ut scribis, Kal. Jun. Romā profectus es, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te, ut scribis, cito videbo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil habeo, quod ad te scribam, scribo tamen, non ut te delectem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsultum si erit factum, scribes ad me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scripsi etiam ad Camillum, ad Lamiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā (epistulā) de agro Campano scribis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nuper me scis scripsisse ad te de Varronis erga me officio, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hermae tui Pentelici, de quibus ad me scripsisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; 1, 9, 2 et saep.— With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">velim domum ad te scribas, ut mihi tui libri pateant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me scriberet, ut in Italiam quam primum venirem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; 5, 11, 6.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules Fulvio, ut ex Falisco, Postumio, ut ex Vaticano exercitum ad Clusium admoveant, scribunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:27" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 29</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipioni scribendum, ne bellum remitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 23</bibl></cit>.—With simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribit Labieno, si rei publicae commodo facere posset, cum legione ad fines Nerviorum veniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In Tac. also, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribitur tetrarchis ac regibus, jussis Corbulonis obsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—In eccl. Lat. as a formula of quotation from the Scriptures: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptum est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>it is said in Holy Writ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:19:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 19, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 11, 8</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43092.9" n="B" level="2"> Publicists', milit., jurid., and business t. t., of written plans, drafts, and other writings of various import. </sense><sense id="n43092.10" n="1" level="3"> Publicists' t. t., <hi rend="ital">to draw up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draught</hi> a law, decree, treaty, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod proditum memoria est, X. viros, qui leges scripserint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 36, 61</bibl></cit>; 2, 10, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:25:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 25, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:19:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 19, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:38:68 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 38, 68 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a transf. signif.: cui non apparet, inopiam et miseriam civitatis istam legem scripsisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum, quod pietas, fides, pudor scripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec senatusconsulta non ignoro ab amicissimis ejus, cujus de honore agitur, scribi solere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—So very freq.: senatusconsulto scribendo, or simply scribendo adesse, or also, ad scribendum esse, <hi rend="ital">to witness the drawing up of a decree of the Senate; to subscribe it</hi>: erat nobis dictum, te existimare, alicui senatusconsulto, quod contra dignitatem tuam fieret, scribendo Lamiam<pb n="1648" /> <cb n="SCRI" />  affuisse, qui omnino consulibus illis numquam fuit ad scribendum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 29, 2</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: senatusconsulta scribuntur apud familiarem meum (i. e. Caesarem). Et quidem cum in mentem venit (Caesari), ponor ad scribendum (i. e. <hi rend="ital">he adds my signature to it</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod me esse ad scribendum vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 3</bibl>: S. C. auctoritas. Pridie Kal. Octob. in aede Apollinis scrib. affuerunt L. Domitius, etc., an official formula ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 5 sq.</bibl> (v. assum): <cit><quote lang="la">Boeotorum gentem numquam ad scribendum amicitiae foedus adduci potuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>to make</tr>, <tr>enter into</tr>, <tr>conclude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43092.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>: scribere milites (legiones, supplementum, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to enlist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enroll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">levy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 43, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitui supplementum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplementum legionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:20" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">socios navales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 2</bibl></cit>; so, too: sex milia colonorum Albam in Aequos, <hi rend="ital">to enroll</hi> for the purpose of sending, <hi rend="ital">to send</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">socios scribere in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43092.12" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scribe tui gregis hunc,</quote> <trans><tr>enroll him among your retinue</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43092.13" n="3" level="3"> Jurid. and business t. t.: dicam scribere (alicui), like <foreign lang="greek">di/khn gra/fein tini/,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">to bring an action in writing</hi> against any one (v. dica); of a lawyer, <hi rend="ital">to draw up</hi> legal instruments (complaints or charges, contracts, wills, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">Servius hanc urbanam militiam respondendi, scribendi, cavendi secutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 14</bibl> Manut.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia testamenta tu scribes unus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:25" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 2, 25</bibl>.—Hence, transf., with a personal object: aliquem heredem, <hi rend="ital">to appoint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">designate any one as heir</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum palam fecerat et illum heredem et me scripserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 18, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in testamento Ptolemaei patris heredes erant scripti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem Micipsa testamento secundum heredem scripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 65:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 65, 1</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Alex. 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:43:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 43, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:161" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:87" default="NO">9, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem coheredem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem exheredem,</quote> <trans><tr>to disinherit any one by will</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:4:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 4, 8</bibl></cit>, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">1 and 6: aliquem tutorem liberis suis,</quote> <trans><tr>to appoint as guardian by will</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem servo,</quote> <trans><tr>to bequeath to a slave his freedom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:71" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 71</bibl></cit>.—Of contracts, notes, drafts, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchre scripsti: scitum syngraphum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: nummos, usuras, etc. (alicui), <hi rend="ital">to give a note</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bond for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribit nummos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi creditam pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:9:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 9, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genero usuras praestandas quasi ex dotis promissione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:17" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecta est cautio hujusmodi: Lutius Titius scripsi, me accepisse a Publio Maevio quindecim mutua numerata mihi de domo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:40" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: scribe decem (tabulas) a Nerio, <hi rend="ital">give ten notes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bonds drawn up by the usurer Nerius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 69</bibl>. scriptos expendere nummos, v. l. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 105</bibl> (Hold. cautos); cf. rescribo.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">something written</hi>, viz., </sense><sense id="n43092.14" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">A line;</hi> so only: duodecim scripta, <hi rend="ital">a game played with colored stones</hi> (calculi) <hi rend="ital">on a draught-board marked into spaces by twelve oblique lines</hi>: tibi concedo, quod in duodecim scriptis olim, ut calculum reducas, si te alicujus dati poenitet, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 170, 30</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in lusu duodecim scriptorum cum prior calculum promovisset essetque victus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. also scriptula, and Becker, Gall. 3, pp. 261 and 264 sq.: duodecim scriptis ludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 217</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43092.15" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">A written composition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treatise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">book</hi>, <hi rend="ital">work</hi>, etc. (most freq. in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">ex scripto et sententiā controversia nascitur cum videtur scriptoris voluntas cum scripto ipso dissentire,</quote> <trans><tr>the writing</tr>, <tr>the written expression</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibile dictu est, quam multi Graeci de harum valvarum pulchritudine scriptum reliquerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have left something written concerning it</tr>, <tr>speak of it in their writings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:56:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 56, § 124</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 7</bibl>; cf. in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:22:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 22, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod a Democrito et Platone in scriptis relictum esse dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam exstarent illa carmina, quae multis saeculis ante suam aetatem in epulis esse cantata, in Originibus scriptum reliquit Cato!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 19, 75</bibl></cit>: ut ipsis scriptis non ea mandaremus, id. Off. <cb n="SCRI" /> 2, 1, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo libro scriptum hoc invenitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortensius erat memoriā tantā, ut quae secum commentatus esset, ea sine scripto verbis eisdem redderet, quibus cogitavisset,</quote> <trans><tr>without notes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:301" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 88, 301</bibl></cit>; cf. on the contrary: de scripto dicere, <hi rend="ital">to speak</hi> or <hi rend="ital">read from a written paper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recitetur oratio, quae propter rei magnitudinem dicta de scripto est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:30:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 30, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 12, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudavit pater scripto meo,</quote> <trans><tr>in a speech composed by me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adire aliquem scripto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eorum inventis scriptisque se oblectent,</quote> <trans><tr>writings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardeo cupiditate...nomen ut nostrum scriptis illustretur et celebretur tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta recitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosmet Lucili scripta legentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecorum Scripta optima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non accipiet scriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debueram scripto certior esse tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43092.16" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II. B. 1.) Scriptum legis, and simply scriptum, <hi rend="ital">a written ordinance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam tu mihi ex ordine recita de legis scripto populi Romani auctionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Crassus) ita multa tum contra scriptum pro aequo et bono dixit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:39:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 39, 145</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:46:135" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 46, 135</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 47, 138</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(senatus) scripto illo istius sententiam dicere vetabatur,</quote> <trans><tr>rescript</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 26, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scribonius: <entryFree id="n43093" type="main" key="Scri_bo_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scrībōnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n43093.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Scribonius Curio, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 5</bibl> and 6, to whom are addressed <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Fam. 2, 1</bibl>-7.—</sense><sense id="n43093.2" n="2" level="3"> Scribonius Largus Designatianus, <hi rend="ital">a physician in the time of the Emperor Tiberius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of a work</hi> De Compositione medicamentorum.—Also, </sense><sense id="n43093.3" n="3" level="3"> Scribonia, <hi rend="ital">wife of Augustus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom he divorced to marry Livia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scriniarius: <entryFree id="n43094" type="gloss" key="scri_ni^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrīnĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scrinium</etym>, <sense id="n43094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a keeper of the</hi> scrinium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 587, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">643, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1035, 5</bibl>; 1111, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scriniolum: <entryFree id="n43095" type="hapax" key="scri_ni^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrīnĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little case</hi>, <hi rend="ital">box</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">shrine;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">pectoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 77, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scrinium: <entryFree id="n43096" type="main" key="scri_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrīnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>scribo</etym>. <sense id="n43096.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a case</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chest</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">box for keeping books</hi>, <hi rend="ital">papers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">letters</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">a book-box</hi>, <hi rend="ital">letter-case</hi>, <hi rend="ital">escritoir</hi> (not in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: capsa, cista): Flaccum praetorem scrinium cum litteris, quas a legatis acceperat, codem afferre jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 46:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 46, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:23:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 23, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 25, 26, § 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigil calamum et chartas et scrinia posco,</quote> <trans><tr>book-boxes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:257" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 257</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:67:6" default="NO">1, 67, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:33:1" default="NO">4, 33, 1</bibl>; 6, 64, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5:6 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5, 6 al.</bibl>—Under the later emperors there were four kinds of public scrinia, namely, memoriae, epistularum, libellorum, and epistularum Graecarum, Cod. Th. 6, 26; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 19</bibl>; cf. Salmas. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43096.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a case</hi> or <hi rend="ital">casket</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 29, 30, § 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scriplum: <entryFree id="n43097" type="main" key="scriplum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriplum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. scrupulus, I. B.</entryFree>
scriptilis: <entryFree id="n43098" type="main" key="scripti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scribo</etym>, <sense id="n43098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be written</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">elementa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elementorum viginti quattuor scriptiles formae incisae perite,</quote> <trans><tr>letters</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 29, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
