scriptio: <entryFree id="n43099" type="main" key="scripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a writing</hi> (almost confined to Cic.). * </sense><sense id="n43099.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the art of writing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (lippitudo) impediat scriptionem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43099.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43099.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A composing in writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla res tantum ad dicendum proficit, quantum scriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 24, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam scriptione dignam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituta scriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus scriptionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:12:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 12, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 11, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex scriptione interpretari,</quote> <trans><tr>according to the letter</tr>, <tr>literally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:38:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 38, 68</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impulsi sumus ad philosophiae scriptiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 121</bibl></cit> (also ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 174, 19</bibl>).—* </sense><sense id="n43099.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A note</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bond</hi>: avarus fenerator spe lucri Rem scriptione duplicarat, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 174, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scriptionalis: <entryFree id="n43100" type="main" key="scripti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scriptio</etym>, <sense id="n43100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to writing</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 463</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scriptito: <entryFree id="n43101" type="main" key="scripti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptĭto</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-pto</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 825</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1224</bibl> P.), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>scribo</etym>. * <sense id="n43101.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to write often</hi>: in palmarum foliis <cb n="SCRI" /> primo scriptitatum est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 21, § 69</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n43101.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to write</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>, etc. (usually with accessory notion of writing at one's own will, not officially or professionally; cf. Ellendt ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2, p. 220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, p. 220</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): et haec et si quid aliud ad me scribas velim vel potius scriptites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Bibulus scriptitavit accurate,</quote> <trans><tr>wrote</tr>, <tr>composed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:77:267" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 77, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi diu multumque scriptitarit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci quoque ipsi sic initio scriptitarunt, ut noster Cato,</quote> <trans><tr>used to write</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(primus Antonius) scriptitasse Othoni credebatur ducem se partibus offerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Primum et Varum media scriptitabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia sanctissimos homines scriptitasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scriptiuncula: <entryFree id="n43102" type="main" key="scripti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scriptio</etym>, <sense id="n43102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little piece of writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little treatise</hi> (late Lat.), Salv. Gub. Dei, praef.</sense></entryFree>
scriptor: <entryFree id="n43103" type="main" key="scriptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scribo</etym>, <sense id="n43103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who writes.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43103.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (acc. to scribo, I.), <hi rend="ital">a writer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretary</hi> (syn. librarius; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): addebat etiam, scriptores illos male multatos exisse cum Galbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 22, 88</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptor librarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ejus (Crassi) scriptore et lectore Diphilo suspicari liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:30:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 30, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Seneca) advocatis scriptoribus pleraque tradidit, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 9, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43103.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (acc. to scribo, II.). </sense><sense id="n43103.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One that composes in writing; a writer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reporter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrator</hi>, etc. (the ruling signif. of the word; syn. auctor). </sense><sense id="n43103.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium bonarum artium scriptores atque doctores et legendi et pervolutandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:8" default="NO">7, 7, 8</bibl>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: quam multos scriptores rerum suarum magnus ille Alexander secum habuisse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rerum scriptor,</quote> <trans><tr>an historian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: historiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:99" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum, Treb. Poll. Trig. Tyr. 18: carminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tragoediarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:97" default="NO">10, 1, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteris comoediae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iamborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:59" default="NO">10, 1, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mimorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Satyrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojani belli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuarum rerum domesticos habes et scriptores et nuntios,</quote> <trans><tr>reporters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43103.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne genus scriptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustissimus ille scriptor ac politissimus Lysias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia provenere ibi (sc. Athenis) scriptorum magna ingenia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: utriusque linguae, <hi rend="ital">in Latin and Greek</hi>, Gell. praef. § 4; so of an historian: in tantā scriptorum turbā, Liv. praef. § 2 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:20:4 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 20, 4 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fere scriptores carmine foedo Splendida facta linunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 236</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of poets,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptorum chorus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilium scriptorum auditor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 120</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:1:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 1, 17 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43103.6" n="B" level="2"> Publicists' and jurid. t. t. (acc. to scribo, II. B.), <hi rend="ital">a drawer up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compiler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draughter</hi> of any thing. </sense><sense id="n43103.7" n="1" level="3"> Legum (Numa), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:47:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 47, 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43103.8" n="2" level="3"> Alieni testamenti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 17</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:11" default="NO">7, 6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scriptorius: <entryFree id="n43104" type="main" key="scripto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">writing-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atramentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 28, 12</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">grafi/on,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a metallic style for writing on wax tablets</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 6, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scriptula: <entryFree id="n43105" type="hapax" key="scriptu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scriptum, A.</etym>, <sense id="n43105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lines on the draught-board in the game of</hi> duodecim-scripta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 364</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scriptulum: <entryFree id="n43106" type="main" key="scriptu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. scrupulus, I. B.</entryFree>
scriptum: <entryFree id="n43107" type="main" key="scriptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. scribo <sense id="n43107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scriptura: <entryFree id="n43108" type="main" key="scriptu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scribo</etym>, <sense id="n43108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">written characters.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43108.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (acc. to scribo, I.; <cit><quote lang="la">Cic. uses scriptio instead): minium in voluminibus quoque scriptura usurpatur clarioresque litteras vel in auro vel in marmore etiam in sepulchris facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(meorum librorum) scriptura quanti constet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:67:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 67, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl>: mendum scripturae, <hi rend="ital">an error in writing</hi>, Caecin. ap. Cic Fam. 6, 7, 1.—* </sense><sense id="n43108.2" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a line</hi> (syn. scriptum): <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia usque ad malarum scripturam currentia,</quote> <trans><tr>the boundary line between the cheeks and eyelids</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43108.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n43108.4" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to scribo, II.) <pb n="1649" /> <cb n="SCRO" /> <hi rend="ital">A writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composition</hi> (cf. scriptura). </sense><sense id="n43108.5" n="1" level="3"> Abstr., = scriptio: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus optimus dicendi effector ... Nam si subitam et fortuitam orationem commentatio facile vincit: hanc ipsa profecto assidua ac diligens scriptura superabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem posse omnis res per scripturam complecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 152</bibl></cit>: quod si scripturam sprevissem in praesentiā, <hi rend="ital">writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composing</hi>, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 16: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptura levis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phorm. prol. 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: genus scripturae, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 3</bibl>; Liv 25, 12; Suet. Vit. Juven.; Nep. praef. § 1; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: Naevii Punicum bellum continenti scripturā expositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 2</bibl></cit>: C. Furnio legato plura verbo quam scriptura mandata dedimus, <hi rend="ital">rather orally than in writing</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">edebat per libellos scripturā brevi,</quote> <trans><tr>written briefly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43108.6" n="2" level="3"> Concr., = scriptum. </sense><sense id="n43108.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Something written</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a writing</hi> (rare, and not in Cic., for scriptum, liber, libellus): ne cum poëtā scriptura evanesceret, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ad. prol. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diurna actorum, i. e. acta diurna,</quote> <trans><tr>the public paper of the State</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo annales nostros cum scripturā eorum contenderit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alterā scripturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">an inscription</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuae aetatem scriptura indicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:61:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 61, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43108.8" n="b" level="4"> In eccl. writers: <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh\n</foreign> Scriptura, or, in the <number>plur.</number>, Scripturae, <hi rend="ital">the Scriptures</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:21:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 21, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Johan. 7, 42</bibl>.—Esp. <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a scripture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a passage of Scripture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 14, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Johan. 19, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43108.9" n="B" level="2"> Publicists' and jurid. t. t. </sense><sense id="n43108.10" n="1" level="3"> Public. </sense><sense id="n43108.11" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A tax paid on public pastures</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">advorsum legem a me ob meam scripturam pecudem accepit Aeraque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:42 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 42 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:65:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 65, 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n43108.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A written law</hi> (syn. lex scripta): <cit><quote lang="la">cum per ignorantiam scripturae multa commissa fierent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43108.13" n="2" level="3"> Jurid. t. t. </sense><sense id="n43108.14" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A testamentary provision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum demonstrandum est, non esse ambigue scriptum ... Deinde ex superiore et ex inferiore scripturā docendum, etc. ... quae autem ex omni consideratā scripturā perspicua fiant, haec ambigua non oportere existimari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:40:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 40, 117</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43108.15" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A will</hi>: suprema, Cod. Th. 16, 1, 40.</sense></entryFree>
scripturarius: <entryFree id="n43109" type="main" key="scriptu_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptūrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scriptura, II. B. 1. a.</etym>. <sense id="n43109.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the tax on pastures</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripturarius ager publicus appellatur, in quo ut pecora pascantur certum aes est: quia publicanus scribendo conficit rationem cum pastore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=333" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 333</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n43109.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptūrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who collected the tax on pasturage</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 38, 5</bibl> (acc. to Non. an ancient name for tabularius).</sense></entryFree>
scripturio: <entryFree id="n43110" type="main" key="scriptu_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptūrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n43110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. desid. n.</hi> [scribo], <hi rend="ital">to desire to write</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scriptus: <entryFree id="n43111" type="main" key="scriptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from scribo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43112" type="main" key="scriptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scribo</etym>, <sense id="n43112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a scribe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">secretary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a clerkship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretaryship</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quem aliquanto ante desisse scriptum facere arguit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: Cn. Flavius scriptum faciebat ... dicitur tabulas posuisse, scriptu sese abdicasse, L. Piso ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:9:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 9, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Amic. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Amic. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestorius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Hor. p. 44:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Hor. p. 44, 8</bibl></cit>: censorius, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scripularis: <entryFree id="n43113" type="main" key="scri_pu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrīpŭlāris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scrūpŭl-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scrupulus</etym>, <sense id="n43113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">amounting to a scruple</hi> (in weight; <cit><quote lang="la">post-Aug.): differentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 8, 43, § 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scripulatim: <entryFree id="n43114" type="main" key="scri_pu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrīpŭlātim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scrūpŭlāt-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos><etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by scruples</hi> (in weight; <cit><quote lang="la">post-Aug.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 56, § 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scripulum: <entryFree id="n43115" type="main" key="scri_pu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrīpŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scriplum, scriptŭ-lum</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scriptlum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, corrupt collat. form of scrupulus, which became the prevailing one in the sense of <sense id="n43115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scruple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small weight;</hi> v. scrupulus, I. B.</sense></entryFree>
scrobiculus: <entryFree id="n43116" type="main" key="scro^bi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrŏbĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scrobis</etym>, <sense id="n43116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little ditch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trench</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 225, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:15:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:8" default="NO">5, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 30:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 13, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scrobis: <entryFree id="n43117" type="main" key="scro^bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrŏbis</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrobs</orth>, only acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 751</bibl> P., and by a false read. in some edd. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:1" default="NO">5, 5, 1</bibl> sq.; 5, 6, 18; 5, 10, 4), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, less freq. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root skrabh-, <cb n="SCRU" /> v. scribo</etym>. <sense id="n43117.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a ditch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trench</hi> (syn. fossa; class.); <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 225</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Fragm. ib. 11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Fragm. ib. 11</bibl>; Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 2, 288</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:2" default="NO">5, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:4" default="NO">5, 5, 4</bibl>; 5, 6, 18 et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>, Gracchus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 2, 288</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:756" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 756</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:46:4" default="NO">12, 46, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 57, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43117.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43117.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A grave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:97:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 97, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 67</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43117.3" n="2" level="3"> Virginalis = pudendum muliebre, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scrofa: <entryFree id="n43118" type="main" key="scro_fa1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrōfa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root skrabh-, v. scribo</etym>, <sense id="n43118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breeding-sow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:11:3" default="NO">7, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:177" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:73" default="NO">12, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43119" type="main" key="Scro_fa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scrōfa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. scrofa</etym>, <sense id="n43119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, taken from swine-breeding, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 1 sq.</bibl> (a less probable derivation is given by <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 13 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
scrofinus: <entryFree id="n43120" type="main" key="scro_fi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrōfīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a sow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 46, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scrofipascus: <entryFree id="n43121" type="hapax" key="scro_fi^pascus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrōfĭpascus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. scrofa-pasco</etym>, <sense id="n43121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who keeps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">breeds sows</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scrofulae: <entryFree id="n43122" type="hapax" key="scro_fu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrōfŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. scrofa</etym>, <sense id="n43122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swelling of the glands of the neck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrofula</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 23, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scrotum: <entryFree id="n43123" type="main" key="scro_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrōtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. for scortum, I.</etym>, <sense id="n43123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the scrotum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scrupeda: <entryFree id="n43124" type="main" key="scru_pe^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpĕda</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpĭpĕda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scrupus-pes</etym>, <sense id="n43124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hobbling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shambling</hi> (perh. = <foreign lang="greek">kroi/peza,</foreign> wearing high wooden shoes), Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 6</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 169, 8</bibl>; Aur. and Juvent. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 65</bibl> Müll.; cf. Com. Rel. p. 83 Rib.</sense></entryFree>
scrupeus: <entryFree id="n43125" type="main" key="scru_pe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scrupus</etym>. <sense id="n43125.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of pointed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sharp stones; sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rugged</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">saxum, Enn. ap. Fest. s. v. scrupi, p. 333 Müll. (Trag. v. 139 Vahl.): spelunca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada (undae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 556" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 556</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ora (Ismeni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:411" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43125.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (Achilles) scrupeā scholā eruditus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficultas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12 praef.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">difficulty</hi>: reicis abs te religionem: scrupeam imponas tibi? Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 65</bibl> M. (Trag. Rel. v. 431 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
scrupipeda: <entryFree id="n43126" type="main" key="scru_pi^pe^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpĭpĕda</orth>, v. scrupeda.</entryFree>
scruposus: <entryFree id="n43127" type="main" key="scru_po_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scrupus</etym>. <sense id="n43127.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full of sharp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rough stones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jagged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rugged</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): specus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 223, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 675</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 187, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 348, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per asperitates scruposas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n43127.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arduous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 523</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scrupularis: <entryFree id="n43128" type="main" key="scru_pu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpŭlāris</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scrūpŭlātim</orth>, v. scrip.</entryFree>
scrupulose: <entryFree id="n43129" type="main" key="scru_pu^lo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpŭlōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. scrupulosus <sense id="n43129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scrupulositas: <entryFree id="n43130" type="main" key="scru_pu^lo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpŭlōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scrupulosus</etym> (very rare), <sense id="n43130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">over-nicety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrupulosity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac ruris disciplinā non desideratur ejusmodi scrupulositas: sed quod dicitur pingui Minervā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:32" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; Hier. Ep. Gal. prol.</sense></entryFree>
scrupulosus: <entryFree id="n43131" type="main" key="scru_pu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>scrupulus</etym>. <sense id="n43131.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full of small sharp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pointed stones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rugged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jagged</hi> (rare but class.): specus, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 713</bibl> P.: tamquam e scrupulosis cotibus enavigavit oratio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 14, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruminatio corticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltibus degressi scrupulosis et inviis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera aurium,</quote> <trans><tr>for wearing jewelled drops</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43131.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (only post-Aug.), <hi rend="ital">very nice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrupulous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquisitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 64" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupulosa quaedam et anxia in his commentariis, Gell. praef. § 13: locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lector,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupulosus in deferendis potestatibus celsis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 9, 3</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides quorundam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio ventorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 32, 75, § 325</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultus deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 43, 2</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpŭlōsē</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrupulously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupulose in partes sectā divisionis diligentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minutius et scrupulosius scrutantur omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 28</bibl></cit>: scrupulosius tractabo ventos, Plin. <cb n="SCRU" /> 2, 46, 45, § 118.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: requirant corporis gesticulatorem, Col. praef. § 3.</sense></entryFree>
scrupulum: <entryFree id="n43132" type="main" key="scru_pu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. scrupulus, I. B.</entryFree>
scrupulus: <entryFree id="n43133" type="main" key="scru_pu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpŭlus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">scrīŭplum</orth>, etc., <sense id="n43133.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, B.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>scrupus</etym>. * </sense><sense id="n43133.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a small sharp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pointed stone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ater scrupulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43133.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43133.3" n="1" level="3"> T. t., <hi rend="ital">the smallest division of weight</hi> (the 24th part of an ounce), <hi rend="ital">a scruple;</hi> in this sense the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrīpŭlum</orth> (less commonly <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrū-pŭlum</orth>; also written, because of a fancied derivation from scriptum, <orth extent="full" lang="la">scriptŭlum</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">scriptlum</orth>) is most freq.: scriptulum, quod nunc vulgo sine <hi rend="ital">t</hi> dicunt, Varro ap. Plautin. dixit. Idem tertio Annali. Is (nummus argenteus) quattuor scriptulis major fuit quam nunc est, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ibi auri scrupulum imponatur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripula octo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:28:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picis sex scripula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:23:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque marathri scrupula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripulum nostri dixere priores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rhem. Fan.</author> Pond. 8 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut scripulum valeret sestertiis vicenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:89:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 89, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:55:3" default="NO">10, 55, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43133.4" n="2" level="3"> Of other measures. </sense><sense id="n43133.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The twenty-fourth part of an</hi> uncia <hi rend="ital">of land</hi> (the 288th part of a jugerum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43133.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The twenty-fourth part of an hour</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVAE HIC DORMIT VIXIT ANN. XXI. MENS. III. HOR. IV. SCRVPVLOS VI.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 97, 219</bibl></cit> (ap. Orell. 4718, n. 1); M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Caes. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Caes. 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43133.7" n="c" level="4"> Of any other very small measure, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 26" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 10, 7, § 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43133.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, a pricking, stinging, uneasy sensation; hence, </sense><sense id="n43133.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Uneasiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difficulty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anxiety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scruple</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc sibi ex animo scrupulum, qui se dies noctesque stimulat ac pungit, ut evellatis postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui scripulus tenuissimus residere aliquis videbitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi unus scrupulus restat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fuit in re hac scrupulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injeci scrupulum homini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 61</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi potius addantur quam ullus sit scrupulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tum injectus est hominibus scrupulus et quaedam dubitatio, quidnam esset actum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 28, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exime hunc mihi scrupulum, cui par esse non possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis surculus ... sine scrupulo egregie inseritur,</quote> <trans><tr>without scruple</tr>, <tr>without hesitation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:25:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 25, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupulus non mediocris me carpebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 184, 11</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticarum sollicitudinum aculeos omnes et scrupulos occultabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus scrupulo quaestionis liberatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 305 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n43133.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A painfully minute examination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a subtlety</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:15:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 15, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scrupus: <entryFree id="n43134" type="main" key="scru_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n43134.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a rough</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sharp stone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">* scrupi dicuntur aspera saxa et difficilia attrectatu, Fest. pp. 332 and 333 Müll. (very rare): cum horā paene totā per omnes scrupos traxissemus cruentos pedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 79, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupus proprie est lapillus brevis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 238</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Descr. Orb. 503</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43134.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">anxiety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solicitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uneasiness</hi> (for the usual scrupulus, q. v. II.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod vacua metu, curā, sollicitudine, periculo vita bonorum virorum sit: contra autem improbis semper aliqui scrupus in animis haereat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:16:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 16, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scruta: <entryFree id="n43135" type="main" key="scru_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sibilated from <foreign lang="greek">gru/th</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n43135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">old</hi> or <hi rend="ital">broken stuff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frippery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trumpery</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 62, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl> Esdr. 3, 30.</sense></entryFree>
scrutanter: <entryFree id="n43136" type="main" key="scru_tanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtanter</orth>, v. scrutor <sense id="n43136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scrutarius: <entryFree id="n43137" type="main" key="scru_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>scruta</etym>. <sense id="n43137.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to trash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frippery</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">trumpery</hi>: SERVVS, perh. <hi rend="ital">a dealer in such things</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2954</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43137.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> * </sense><sense id="n43137.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrū-tārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in second-hand clothes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a broker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ragman</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:14:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 14, 10</bibl> (v. scruta).—* </sense><sense id="n43137.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the business of a</hi> scrutarius, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 146, 17</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n43137.4" n="C" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtārĭum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">grutopwlei=on,</foreign> Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
scrutatio: <entryFree id="n43138" type="hapax" key="scru_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scrutor</etym>, <sense id="n43138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a searching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigating</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare). </sense><sense id="n43138.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>a searching</tr>, <tr>search</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43138.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulsa nimis et odiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:10:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; Oros. praef. p. 5. <pb n="1650" /> <cb n="SCUL" /></sense></entryFree>
scrutator: <entryFree id="n43139" type="main" key="scru_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>scrutor</etym>, <sense id="n43139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a searcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrutinizer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examiner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigator</hi> (postAug.). </sense><sense id="n43139.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutatoribus scrutatores semper apposuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 1, 9</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundi pelagi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fishermen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:84" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 298</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43139.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an examiner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cordis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scrutatrix: <entryFree id="n43140" type="main" key="scru_ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>scrutator, II.</etym>, <sense id="n43140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that searches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examines</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">inquires into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum (Eva),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 2, 326</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
scrutatus: <entryFree id="n43141" type="main" key="scru_ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of scrutor.</entryFree>
scrutillus: <entryFree id="n43142" type="hapax" key="scru_tillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pork-sausage</hi>, Plaut. ap. Fest. pp. 332 and 333 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
scrutinium: <entryFree id="n43143" type="main" key="scru_ti^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>scrutor</etym>, <sense id="n43143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a search</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inquiry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scruting</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 237, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 63</bibl> (64), 7.</sense></entryFree>
scruto: <entryFree id="n43144" type="main" key="scru_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. scrutor <sense id="n43144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
scrutor: <entryFree id="n43145" type="main" key="scru_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtor</orth>, <itype>āri, ātus</itype>, <sense id="n43145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [scruta; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">gruteu/ei,</foreign> scrutatur, Gloss. Philox.], qs. to search even to the rags, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to search carefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine thoroughly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explore</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">to search</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examine</hi> a person (syn.: indago, rimo). </sense><sense id="n43145.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">domos, naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca abdita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia foramina parietum scrutatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 98, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paleam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terraï abdita ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:809" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 809</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem gladio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 965" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 965</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrutatus sum quae potui et quae vidi omnia: inveni duos solos libellos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:74:section=182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 74, § 182</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Crassus spiculis prope scrutatus est Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 26, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occulta saltuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 45</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scrutandi orbis gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis scrutatur vestigia (ferarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venantium latibula scrutatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias presso ore (canis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 499" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum delicta scrutantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—Of personal objects: <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Ostende huc manum dexteram ... Nunc laevam ostende ... Jam scrutari mitto, <hi rend="ital">to search you</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non excutio te, non scrutor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 97</bibl></cit>; so of searching, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 31, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem salutantes scrutandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of a searching for spoil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43145.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to seek for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">search out</hi> a thing (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">venas melini inter saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 19, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 172</bibl></cit>; cf. infra, II. B.—</sense><sense id="n43145.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to examine thoroughly; to explore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi>: quod est ante pedes nemo spectat: caeli scrutantur plagas, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 13, 30</bibl> (Trag. v. 277 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sordes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3, § 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">cf: nomina ac vultus, alacritatem tristitiamque coëuntium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos ceterorum secretis sermonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locos, ex quibus argumenta eruamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 2, 34, 146</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desinamus aliquando ea scrutari, quae sunt inania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non ratione scrutabimur, non poterimus invenire nisi casu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interiores et reconditas litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">origines nominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia minutius et scrupulosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 14, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inferiora quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoletos auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripturas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 5, 39</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum diem mecum scrutor, facta ac dicta mea remetior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:36:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 36, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43145.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (cf. supra, I. B.), <hi rend="ital">to search into; to search out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">find out</hi> a thing (so not till after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">fibras Inspiciunt, mentes deum scrutantur in illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finem principis per Chaldaeos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua Caesarisque fata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcanum ullius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut causas hujus infinitae differentiae scrutetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 30, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenarum numerum et montium pondera scrutari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 34</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype> (late Lat.), perh. only in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that most closely examines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaris rei ordinum scrutantissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">searchingly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 80</bibl>.<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 799</bibl> P; cf. <foreign lang="greek">gruteu/w,</foreign> scruto, Gloss. Philox.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43145.5" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">scrūtor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. 6:3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sculna: <entryFree id="n43146" type="main" key="sculna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sculna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contr. from seculna</etym>, in vulg. lang. = sequester, <sense id="n43146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mediator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arbiter</hi>,<cb n="SCUR" />  <hi rend="ital">umpire</hi>, Lavin. and Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sculpo: <entryFree id="n43147" type="main" key="sculpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sculpo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">glu/fw,</foreign> to hollow out, grave; also scalpo, <foreign lang="greek">gla/fw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n43147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chisel</hi> in stone, brass, wood, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">produce by carving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graving</hi>, etc. (very rare but class.; in the MSS. very freq. interchanged with scalpere). </sense><sense id="n43147.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: non est e saxo sculptus aut e robore dolatus, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">niveum mirā arte Sculpsit ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sculptum infabre, quid fusum durius esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denticulos in coronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 224</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gemmā ancoram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43147.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43147.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Dicet scripta et, ut Demosthenes ait, si continget, et sculpta, i. e. <hi rend="ital">things wrought out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elaborated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43147.4" n="(b)" level="5"> In animo ejus sculptum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 23, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sculponeae: <entryFree id="n43148" type="main" key="sculpo_ne^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sculpōnĕae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. kindred with <foreign lang="greek">krou/pala</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n43148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inferior kind of wooden shoe</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">135, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 59</bibl>; Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 562, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sculponeatus: <entryFree id="n43149" type="hapax" key="sculpo_ne^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sculpōnĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sculponeae</etym>, <sense id="n43149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing wooden shoes</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 164, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sculptilis: <entryFree id="n43150" type="main" key="sculpti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sculptĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sculpo</etym>, <sense id="n43150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">formed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produced by carving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graving</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">sculptile</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">opus dentis Numidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: forma in aere, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 266. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sculptĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a carved image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statue</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 17, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sculptilia deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:5:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Macc. 5, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos et sculptilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dan. 11, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sculptor: <entryFree id="n43151" type="main" key="sculptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sculptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who cuts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carves</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">engraves</hi> in stone, wood, etc. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fictor, plastes),</quote> <trans><tr>a stone-cutter</tr>, <tr>graver</tr>, <tr>sculptor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5, 4, § 11</bibl> (Jahn reads throughout scalptor); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opere sculptoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 23, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 5</bibl> (sometimes confounded with scalptor).</sense></entryFree>
sculptura: <entryFree id="n43152" type="main" key="sculptu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sculptūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carving in relief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sculpture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus, cujus gemmae sculptura erat Proserpinae raptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulus ejusdem sculpturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43152.1" n="2" level="3"> Concr., esp. in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">marbles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">works of plastic art</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 77, § 209</bibl> (Jahn, scalptura); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sculpturatus: <entryFree id="n43153" type="hapax" key="sculptu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sculptūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sculptura</etym>, <sense id="n43153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sculpture</hi>: ars, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the art of sculpture</hi>, Ven. Carm. 9, 15.</sense></entryFree>
sculptus: <entryFree id="n43154" type="main" key="sculptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sculptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. sculpo.</entryFree>
scultatores: <entryFree id="n43155" type="hapax" key="sculta_to_res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scultātōres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>abbrev. for auscultatores</etym>, <sense id="n43155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of guards</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 17</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
scultenna: <entryFree id="n43156" type="main" key="Scultenna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Scultenna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Upper Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Mutina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowing into the Po</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Panaro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 12</bibl> and 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
scurra: <entryFree id="n43157" type="main" key="scurra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">scurra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n43157.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">an elegant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">town-bred man; a fine gentleman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gallant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dandy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu urbanus vero scurra, deliciae popli, Rus mihi tu objectas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. (opp. militaris) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 17</bibl>.—Also of <hi rend="ital">an elegant debauchee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 17, 39</bibl>; Auct. Har. Resp. 20, 42.—</sense><sense id="n43157.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43157.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A city buffoon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">droll</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jester</hi> (usually in the suite of wealthy persons, and accordingly a kind of parasite; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: sannio, parasitus): urbani assidui cives, quos scurras vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 165</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:62:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 62, § 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 10, 14</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:52:1:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 52, 1, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 6, 20</bibl>.—Zeno sarcastically called Socrates scurra Atticus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinus Asilius, venustissimus inter rhetores scurra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the clown in a pantomime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:111" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 111</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus est: De scurrā multo facilius divitem quam patremfamilias fieri posse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 17, 55</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43157.3" n="2" level="3"> In the times of the later emperors, <hi rend="ital">one of the guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a soldier of the guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a guardsman</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex.
